Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Humanizando la Tecnología.




Somos una gran empresa con alma de start-up. Nos organizamos por unidades de conocimiento expertas que colaboran entre sí.




Por ello buscamos personas inquietas, que les motiven los retos y con ganas de crecer personal y profesionalmente, que se unan a nuestro equipo para tener un impacto positivo en el mundo a través de la tecnología.




¿TE APUNTAS AL RETO?




Buscamos a un Data Analyst con experiencia en modelado de datos y conocimientos avanzados de SQL y Snowflake, para integrarse al 100% en el equipo de la Oficina de Datos. Tu labor será clave en proyectos vinculados al reporting regulatorio, dentro de un ecosistema moderno de datos.




¿QUÉ HARÁS EN TU DÍA A DÍA?




Diseñar y optimizar procesos ETL que aseguren la calidad, consistencia e integridad de los datos utilizados para el reporting.
Desarrollar consultas SQL eficientes y complejas para la explotación y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos.
Diseñar y mantener modelos de datos (especialmente modelos dimensionales), adaptándolos a necesidades funcionales concretas y proponiendo mejoras continuas.
Colaborar estrechamente con equipos técnicos y funcionales para alinear estructuras de datos con los objetivos estratégicos de la universidad.
Documentar de forma clara y estructurada los procesos, transformaciones y modelos de datos, de acuerdo con los estándares internos.




¿QUÉ NECESITAMOS QUE APORTES?




Dominio avanzado de SQL y capacidad para crear consultas complejas y optimizadas.
Experiencia práctica en entornos basados en Snowflake.
Conocimientos sólidos en modelado y arquitectura de datos.
Habilidad para trabajar en entornos colaborativos y multidisciplinares.
Rigor técnico, orientación a la calidad y atención al detalle.
Experiencia previa en entornos universitarios o del ámbito de la educación superior, especialmente en áreas de gestión institucional de datos.
Participación en proyectos de reporting o en iniciativas de cumplimiento regulatorio.
Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Tableau, u otras soluciones de BI.




¿QUE ENCONTRARÁS EN SEIDOR?




Un equipo diverso. Respetamos las diferencias que nos hacen más humanos. 💜
Compañerismo. Trabajamos en equipo y aprendemos los unos de los otros.
Flexibilidad y conciliación. El teletrabajo está en nuestro ADN. Promovemos la flexibilidad horaria, y tenemos jornada intensiva los viernes y los meses de julio y agosto. 🙌
Aprendizaje continuo. Formaciones en idiomas, técnicas, certificaciones, etc.
Carrera profesional individualizada, para que seas tú quien decide hasta dónde quieres llegar. 🚀
Autonomía y posibilidad de proponer y promover nuevas oportunidades.
Programa de retribución flexible. Tickets guardería, restaurante, transporte, y seguro médico.
Descuentos exclusivos y condiciones especiales en tecnología, ocio, viajes, etc. 🌟
Podrás formar parte de iniciativas solidarias y relacionadas con el medio ambiente.
Si tienes inquietudes internacionales, estamos en 45 países. 🌍




¡Únete a nuestro equipo y ayúdanos a humanizar el mundo a través de la tecnología!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (,)
Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingeniería ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Firmware, Software, BI, Diseño, Project Management y muchas más. Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros BETWEEN Labs.

Estamos buscando un/a Senior Data Analyst para ampliar uno de nuestros equipos en el área de analítica promocional/análisis de ventas en importante empresa del sector Retail en Madrid.

Funciones


Analizar y sintetizar grandes volúmenes de datos utilizando herramientas como SQL (Snowflake), Python y Excel para extraer información valiosa que ayude en la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Diseñar dashboards interactivos y reportes utilizando PowerBI y MicroStrategy, asegurando que los stakeholders accedan a información clara y relevante.
Implementar modelos de análisis estadístico, incluyendo estadística descriptiva y análisis de series temporales, específicamente en el sector Retail.
Trabajar con plataformas como Snowflake, PySpark y Snowpark para optimizar los procesos de análisis y mejorar la eficiencia en la gestión de datos.
Extraer, transformar y analizar datos en SQL
Traducir datos complejos en conclusiones claras y accionables
Identificar necesidades y requisitos colaborando con los distintos equipos de negocio (Compras, MKT, …)
Análisis del desempeño de promociones y campañas comerciales mediante seguimiento y evaluación de KPIs


Beneficios

En BETWEEN Creemos En Cuidar De Nuestros Empleados y Ofrecer Un Entorno Que Fomente Su Desarrollo Profesional. Por Ello, Te Ofrecemos


Seguro médico con Sanitas para garantizar tu bienestar y el de tu familia.
Oportunidades de formación en idiomas, certificaciones, bootcamps y mucho más, para ayudarte a continuar creciendo en tus áreas de interés.
Participación en una variedad de eventos sociales y de team building como BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race, entre otros, que fomentan la cohesión y el trabajo en equipo.
Retribución flexible que incluye beneficios como comedores, transporte y guarderías, para que puedas organizar tu salario de la manera que mejor te convenga.
Incentivos por validar o recomendar talento, reconociendo así la importancia de contar con un equipo diverso y capacitado.


Requisitos


Formación: Grado en Matemáticas, Física o Ingeniería
Conocimientos en estadística descriptiva y series temporales
Tecnologías requeridas: SQL (snowflake), Python, Excel, PowerBI, Azure Synapse.
Tecnologías deseables: PySpark, Snowpark, MicroStrategy
Muy valorable experiencia en sector Retail o proyectos de analítica promocional y análisis de ventas.

  • Tecnologías requeridas: SQL (snowflake), Python, Excel, PowerBI, Azure Synapse.
  • Tecnologías deseables: PySpark, Snowpark, MicroStrategy
  • Muy valorable experiencia en sector Retail o proyectos de analítica promocional y análisis de ventas.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst plays a crucial role in consolidating, analyzing, and optimizing operational and financial reporting across multiple countries. This role ensures accurate data insights for process improvements and acts as a bridge between IT and operational teams. Additionally, the Senior Analyst serves as a Project Management Office (PMO) coordinator, ensuring smooth project execution and process documentation. The position also involves developing and delivering interactive training sessions to enhance data literacy and process understanding within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, consolidate, and analyze reports from multiple regions to identify trends and performance gaps.
Develop data visualization dashboards and user-friendly reporting tools to improve decision-making.
Identify key data trends and detect anomalies (red flags), providing corrective action recommendations.
Collaborate with IT to ensure process flows are aligned with system capabilities and automation strategies.
Act as a PMO coordinator, tracking project timelines, milestones, and resource allocations.
Document operational processes, ensuring clear and structured process flows.
Support change management initiatives, driving seamless adoption of new systems and reporting structures.
Design and deliver interactive training sessions to enhance data analytics capabilities across teams.
Conduct workshops and hands-on sessions to ensure proper use of reporting tools and dashboards.
Travel regionally to support teams in implementing new data-driven initiatives and provide on-site training when needed.




Qualifications & Experience:

Degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in multinational environments, handling regional data reporting and analytics.
Strong expertise in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and Power BI.
Background in project management, process documentation, and training facilitation.
Familiarity with finance, business analysis, or operational performance tracking.
Fluent English required; additional languages are a plus.




Key Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
High proficiency in data visualization and reporting.
Experience in process improvement and workflow optimization.
Strong project management and change management skills.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across different teams and cultures.
Capability to design and conduct training programs, using interactive methodologies to engage learners.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills, ensuring effective knowledge transfer.

Title: Agente de operaciones SQL
Description:
¿Estás buscando dar un nuevo paso en tu carrera? ¿Te consideras una persona proactiva capaz de liderar cambios en tu entorno? ¿Te interesa adentrarte en el mundo de la consultoría y trabajar para clientes en el ámbito nacional e internacional?




NTT DATA BPO, es una sociedad perteneciente al grupo NTT DATA, la cual presta servicios de externalización de procesos de negocio. Somos la sexta compañía de servicios IT del mundo lo que nos permite dar soluciones de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones tecnológicas, y outsourcing en diversas áreas. Trabajamos con grandes clientes en los sectores de telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, administración pública y sanidad.




Somos una de las pocas compañías en España, con los estándares más altos de excelencia en las condiciones que ofrecemos a nuestros empleados, por eso estamos certificados como Top Employer desde 2016 hasta la actualidad. Apostamos por nuestros empleados y creemos por encima de todo en las personas y en su desarrollo integral, por lo que fomentamos un contexto de libertad responsable que se traduce en un alto rendimiento profesional.




Para nuestra oficina de Madrid, buscamos personas con interés y motivación por la administración en el sector Bancario.




Tus funciones serán dar soporte y asistencia técnica, ayudando a optimizar y crear reporting a partir de la información de los aplicativos de cliente en el ámbito de zinia operaciones.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Formar parte del equipo de profesionales de NTT DATA BPO, lo que significa que desde el primer día ponemos todos los mecanismos necesarios en funcionamiento para que tengas un plan de carrera y formación especializada para el desempeño de tus funciones profesionales:




Contrato Indefinido.
Plan de Carrera profesional en función de la formación, experiencia, potencial profesional y expectativas del candidato.
Formación desde el primer día dirigida a la especialización técnica y de transformación digital.
Salario en función de la experiencia del candidato.
Formato híbrido de trabajo: 3 días presenciales y 2 de teletrabajo.
Integrarte en una compañía multinacional líder (Una de las 10 compañías más grandes del sector a nivel mundial), joven y dinámica.
Formar parte de un ambiente creativo y colaborador donde puedes disfrutar de la experiencia del trabajo en equipo para lograr el máximo valor para nuestros clientes.
Trabajar en una empresa en constante evolución y crecimiento, realizando un trabajo enriquecedor con grandes oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.




¿Te encaja? Esto es lo que valoramos:




Titulación CFGS Administración y Finanzas o Universitaria en ADE, Económicas o similar.
Dominio SQL.
Nivel de inglés B1.
Experiencia en paquete Office, SQL, Power BI...




En NTT DATA creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad. Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad. #WeAreAS #ApplicationServices #ProductDevelopment #ProductEvolution #Agile #Fullstack #Front #Back #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
@ Team Panthr

Expect the unexpected!

We are the first zero-BS talent matchmaker. Empowering individuals through their job seeking journey whilst finding the perfect candidate that fits not only a role but a company vision.

From start to finish, we focus on making the recruitment process smooth and positive for everyone involved.

With more than 15 years of experience in the field, we make use of real data insights, professional expertise and technology. Although we offer worldwide service, our feet are always on the ground and trust is at the heart of what we do, built on transparency and a genuine commitment to seeing you succeed.

Meet our client

Our Client is CONFIDENTIAL

About The Role

A globally renowned bank is seeking a Data Analyst to work on a key transformation initiative following a recent technology merger. The role focuses on data rationalisation, mapping, and modelling across banking and holding systems, contributing to the development of a new data hub and central data warehouse.

Key Responsibilities


Define and help implement business/information system solutions across complex financial platforms.
Lead data mapping, transformation, and flow identification across large datasets.
Deep-dive analysis on data from multiple financial sources.
Collaborate with stakeholders to rationalise and streamline data architecture.
Support the build of a central data warehouse and data hub.
Document and analyse data models and ensure alignment with system integration needs.


About You


Extensive experience in data analysis, mapping, and transformation in large-scale environments.
Strong skills in SQL and experience with Oracle databases.
Proficiency in data modelling and understanding of the software development life cycle.
Solid exposure to financial systems (e.g., FX, Capital Markets) and strong financial product knowledge.
Prior experience with Murex is highly desirable.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Somos Plexus Tech. Una compañía tecnológica especializada en servicios y productos IT, basados en la innovación y el desarrollo. Fundada en el talento y las capacidades de nuestra gente, más de 2.800 profesionales desarrollan tecnología con alma para que organismos públicos, compañías del IBEX 35, grandes retailers, operadores turísticos y entidades financieras crezcan con nosotros.

Si lo que buscas es trabajar con las tecnologías más punteras del mercado y seguir progresando profesionalmente, ¡este es tu proyecto!

¿QUÉ NECESITAMOS DE VOS?

Ampliamos nuestro equipo y estamos buscando un Data Analyst para unirse con nosotros a un importante proyecto del sector bancario.




REQUISITOS:

- Análisis y documentación del flujo de procesos funcionales

- Identificación y documentación de todos los datos utilizados, es decir, entradas, salidas, transformaciones y flujos de datos, en los EUC (end user computing), informes, foros y comités.

- Diseñar / documentar el proceso por realizar

- Crear BRDs y especificaciones técnicas para los conjuntos de datos a ser, incluyendo la especificación de la transformación / mapeos y la integración con las herramientas de BI

- Simplificar y automatizar los datos utilizados en el proceso y la creación de informes

- Pruebas técnicas para garantizar que el código se ajusta a los requisitos y gestionar el proceso UAT, garantizando que se resuelven todas las incidencias.




APTITUDES OBLIGATORIAS:




- Habilidades avanzadas de comunicación escrita y verbal que cubran la recopilación de requisitos, especificaciones, historias de usuario y guías.

- Experiencia práctica en la realización de análisis de datos complejos utilizando SQL.

- Experiencia en la creación de informes de BI incluyendo el aprovisionamiento / modelado de los datos.

- Capacidad para liderar iniciativas de datos y coordinar el compromiso entre usuarios, desarrolladores y gestión del cambio.

- Capacidad para planificar y organizar el propio tiempo dentro de los objetivos y saber cómo se relaciona el trabajo con los demás.

- Experiencia de trabajo con usuarios finales para planificar y ejecutar pruebas de aceptación de usuarios.

- Nivel de ingles mínimo C1

¿QUÉ TE OFRECEMOS?

Contrato indefinido + 100% teletrabajo.
Sistema de retribución flexible en seguro de salud, tickets restaurante, guardería y transporte.
Plan de carrera y formación técnica a medida, para que sigas desarrollándote desde dentro de la compañía.
Formación de idiomas.
Club Benefits de Plexus Tech, que da acceso a ofertas exclusivas en viajes, hogar, salud, tecnología, moda y más categorías.
Formar parte de un equipo dinámico, colaborativo, apasionado por sus clientes y con ganas de dar lo mejor de sí mismo.

Nos apasiona la tecnología, pero sobre todo nos encantan las personas que la hacen posible. Porque con motivación, ilusión y trabajo en equipo estamos haciendo cosas maravillosas.

Plexus Tech mantiene un compromiso firme con las políticas de Igualdad de empresa. Todos nuestros procesos de selección tienen en cuenta la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres de forma transversal, quedando esto reflejado en nuestro Plan de Igualdad.

Fomentamos la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades para toda persona, de modo que ninguna razón de nacimiento, raza, sexo, religión, opinión o cualquier otra condición o circunstancia personal o social cause discriminación. En particular, la organización está comprometida con la creación de un contexto favorable a la diversidad y avance en la erradicación de la discriminación de las personas LGTBI, independientemente de su orientación e identidad sexual o su expresión de género

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description



We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are
At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we’ve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising €250M to revolutionize digital advertising.

Your Challenge

You will propose a new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding.
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasping the attention of the public and transmitting complex information into simple explanations.
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients.
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc).
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales to marketing to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day.
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and actively propose improvements together with the Product Team.
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!

What You’ll Need to Succeed
You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics-related field.
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must.
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative solutions.
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English.
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment.
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills.
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment.
You like to have fun while working and don’t take yourself too serious!
It would be a big plus if you
Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.

Why Join Seedtag?
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.
Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO and optional English or Spanish group classes.
Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.
Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company off-sites, and more!

Additional Perks
Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage is included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV, and let’s grow together!

At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process, and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst, News, Partnerships, Compliance Ops
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Math, Quantitative Science, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience working in data analytics, consulting, data science, engineering, or a technical operations role.
6 years of experience in statistical problem solving and analyzing data sets using SQL or comparable coding language (e.g. Python, R, Java, C++).
3 years of experience working in data analytics, consulting, data science, engineering, or a technical operations role.
Experience in analyzing data using spreadsheet software or building data pipelines and automated workflows.


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, etc.).
5 years of experience with designing experiments, developing statistical models, measurement, and identifying business opportunities.
Experience with data analysis.
Experience in influencing executive leadership on investigative decision making.
Ability to effectively communicate analysis and recommendations across a wide range of non-technical audiences.
Ability to solve problems in complex, fluid, and ambiguous business environments through solid data intuition and business acumen.


About The Job

Google's leadership team hand-picks thorny business challenges, and members of BizOps work in small teams to find solutions. As part of this team you fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insight from analysis, and then zoom out to develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. Taking strategy one step further, you also persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives, roll-up your sleeves to help drive implementation and check back-in to see the impact of your recommendations.

News Partnerships (NP) manages partnerships for Google’s News’ products and programs. These partnerships take many forms - premium content licensing, product integrations, consultative engagements to Digitally Transform or running innovation workshops to develop new solutions with the Industry.

In this role, you will work with News Partnerships’ leadership team to develop partnership and program strategies, build and align operating priorities, and drive compliance globally. You are a critical thinker, influencer, and leader with expertise in simplifying complexity and managing scaled programs at pace.

The Global Partnerships organization is responsible for exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Google’s Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The Global Partnerships team supports Google’s own Product teams with essential partnerships to help Google’s user experiences in advertising, Search, Assistant, Maps, Travel, Shopping, Payments and more. Teams create product-enabling partnerships, go-to-market strategies and incubate business growth for a variety of products.

Responsibilities


Work with various data sources, including large datasets (structured and unstructured) and CRM systems to get actionable insights from vast data sources and develop solutions for compliance for News Partnerships.
Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Partnerships, Engineering, and Legal to update data requirements, create reports, and provide insights.
Build and evaluate models for News compliance.
Enhance the operational workflows, tools and systems via data analysis, technical expertise, and efficient process improvements.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more

  • 6 years of experience working in data analytics, consulting, data science, engineering, or a technical operations role.
  • 6 years of experience in statistical problem solving and analyzing data sets using SQL or comparable coding language (e.g. Python, R, Java, C++).
  • 3 years of experience working in data analytics, consulting, data science, engineering, or a technical operations role.
  • Experience in analyzing data using spreadsheet software or building data pipelines and automated workflows.

Title: Business Intelligence Power BI
Description:
En Logista, tendrás la oportunidad de llegar tan lejos como te propongas. Aprenderás a diario y aportarás valor en un entorno profesional, sólido, diverso, sostenible y tecnológico colaborando con equipos de alto rendimiento. Si buscas dar un salto profesional, vivir nuevas experiencias y estar en constante crecimiento, este es tu lugar. A nosotros nos motiva que consigas éxitos y sobre todo disfrutes del camino ¿y tú? ¿te animas a sumarte a este viaje?




En concreto, Logista Pharma es el único distribuidor farmacéutico independiente que abastece a hospitales y farmacias (España y Portugal) con la más amplia gama de servicios para la industria farmacéutica. Esto nos permite ofrecer el mejor servicio a los sectores en los que estamos altamente especializados, como son, transporte de productos farmacéuticos, transporte de productos de alimentación & retail y productos de alto valor que requieren estrictos protocolos de seguridad.




Precisamos incorporar un/a ANALISTA DE DATOS -Business Intelligence Power BI en nuestras oficinas de Leganés (Madrid)




Responsabilidades:

Exploración de datos, validación de hipótesis, identificación de sesgos, correlaciones y realización de diagnósticos sobre la calidad del dato.
Creación de dashboard e informes en PowerBI para la presentación de resultados a negocio.
Desarrollar nuevos requisitos de visualización y KPI dentro de los paneles de PowerBI con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades comerciales.
Identificar KPI críticos y evaluar demandas.
Participación en las fases de entendimiento del negocio, trabajando conjuntamente con los Business Owners del proyecto.
Mantenimiento y resolución de incidencias de los Dashboards.




Requisitos:

Grado universitario en Ingenierías, Informática + ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística y Empresa, Física o similares. Se valorará máster o posgrado en Analytics o Big Data.
Background y conocimiento de la herramienta Power BI, incluyendo la capacidad de crear modelos de datos, diseñar informes y paneles, utilizar DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) para crear medidas y cálculos personalizados
Perfil analítico
Inglés: Mínimo C1
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That’s why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years’ experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers’ decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive – we succeed together
Trusting – we choose to trust each other
Customer committed – we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused – we accelerate change
Curious – we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie’s Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Power BI Consultant (^)
Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingeniería ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Firmware, Software, BI, Diseño, Project Management y muchas más. Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros BETWEEN Labs.

Estamos buscando un/a Consultor/a de Power BI para ampliar uno de nuestros equipos en Madrid, en el área de visualización (BI) para dar soporte al dominio de Logística.

Funciones

Como Consultor De Power BI, Serás Responsable De Diseñar e Implementar Soluciones De Visualización De Datos Que Ayuden a Tomar Decisiones . Tus Principales Responsabilidades Incluirán


Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards e informes interactivos en Power BI y MicroStrategy.
Colaborar con los equipos de negocio para entender sus necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones efectivas de BI.
Evaluar y optimizar el rendimiento de los informes existentes, proponiendo mejoras continuas en la visualización de datos.


Beneficios

En BETWEEN, Valoramos a Nuestros Empleados y Ofrecemos Una Serie De Beneficios Diseñados Para Mejorar Su Bienestar y Desarrollo Profesional


Seguro médico con Sanitas: Para cuidar de tu salud y la de tu familia.
Oportunidades de formación: Acceso a cursos de idiomas, certificaciones, bootcamps y otros programas de desarrollo profesional.
Multitud de eventos: Participa en actividades como BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race y muchas más, para fomentar la convivencia y el trabajo en equipo.
Retribución flexible: Disfruta de beneficios en restaurantes, transporte y guarderías que se adaptan a tus necesidades.
Incentivos por validar o recomendar talento: Te recompensamos por ayudar a formar un equipo sólido y talentoso en nuestras filas.


Si cumples con un mínimo de 3 años de experiencia en el área de BI, especialmente en herramientas como Power BI y Microstrategy, y deseas sumarte a un equipo dinámico y con proyectos innovadores, no dudes en unirte a nosotros en BETWEEN Technology. Juntos, transformaremos la manera en que nuestros clientes entienden y utilizan sus datos.

Requisitos

Requisitos


Experiencia mínima de 3-5 años en PBI.
Valorable MicroStrategy.
Valorable experiencia en el sector de Logística.
Capacidad para interpretar datos complejos, identificar patrones y proponer soluciones.
Habilidad para traducir análisis técnicos en insights comprensibles para usuarios no técnicos.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Contact Center Operations
Description:
Company Description

At MSX International, a North American multinational and leading consultancy for the automotive industry, we have over 500 experts in Spain and Portugal dedicated to developing and implementing innovative solutions that enhance our clients' business processes and outcomes.

With more than 25 years of industry experience, our multilingual and multicultural Contact Center operates with a proactive and dynamic approach. Our diverse team consistently contributes ideas, makes informed decisions, and collaborates to ensure each client feels unique and fully satisfied with our exceptional service.

Today, our team comprises over 170 professionals, and thanks to our commitment to excellence, we continue to grow!

Job Description

Do you have a passion for data analytics and making sense of complex information?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and support our Contact Center operations. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain data models and dashboards, delivering actionable insights into customer data. This technical position is key to driving decision-making and identifying new opportunities to enhance performance.

Key Responsibilities


Design and develop KPI dashboards to enhance decision-making and performance tracking.
Leverage data mining techniques and reporting tools to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Prepare analytics reports in a clear and professional presentation format.
Collaborate on establishing effective data ETL practices and processes.
Conduct research and analyze ad-hoc studies as required.
Document process flows and business rules, ensuring up-to-date and accurate records.
Process and analyze large datasets, keeping current reports updated and relevant.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in fast-paced industries like automotive or similar businesses preferred.
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Proficiency in SQL for querying relational databases.
Expertise in data manipulation, complex analysis, and statistical modeling.
Excellent analytical skills to interpret and communicate data insights effectively.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with ETL tools (e.g., SSIS, Alteryx, KNIME).
Familiarity with Training, Learning, Development, or Talent Management teams.
Strong multitasking, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented with a proactive and solutions-driven mindset.
Full professional proficiency in English is required.
Ability to perform advanced statistical analysis.


Additional Information

What we offer:


Be part of a great team of professionals in an internationally consolidated company.
MSX Bazaar: A collective purchasing portal with fantastic discounts for employees.
The possibility to join the Flexible Compensation Plan (including medical insurance, transport card, meal card, training, and more).
23 working days of vacation per year, as stipulated by the collective agreement.
Additional incentives such as employee referral programs, opportunities as internal trainers, recognition for new business contributions, and more.
You will be working from our Madrid office in a 50% hybrid position, with the first 5-6 months approx. fully on-site for the adaptation period. Our office is located at C. de Albasanz, 15, San Blas-Canillejas, 28037 Madrid.
Salary: €30,000 gross per year.


MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Mira

Mira is a San Francisco-based hormonal health company providing integrative care and hormonal testing for over 92,000 customers. In 2023, they were recognized by Inc. 5000 as America's fastest-growing femtech company. We started our company to help women and individuals reach their parenthood dreams and make their fertility journey smoother.

Mira’s most important breakthrough was inventing the market's only FDA-compliant at-home fertility monitor with quantitative technology. Since the beginning, they have been on a mission to develop data-driven hormonal health solutions to help women make confident health decisions during every stage of their lives—from the menstrual stage to menopause. Mira offers solutions to test, boost, and navigate fertility—starting from comprehensive hormone testing and supplements to fertility coaching and online courses.

We are committed to helping our customers achieve the highest possible success rates and outcomes; that is why our focus is on personalized care, the use of the most cutting-edge technology, and science-backed data.

About The Position

We are looking for a part-time Marketing Data Analyst **to enhance Mira’s decision-making processes through advanced data analysis and actionable insights. The ideal candidate is experienced in marketing analytics, e-commerce sector, and data visualization through Looker.

The role is a remote position, with a 20-hour workweek, flexible working hours and occasional overlap with the US team. There is potential for the role to evolve into a full-time position based on performance and company needs in 2-3 months.

If want to challenge yourself at a high-growth startup and make a difference for women's health please join us!

Responsibilities


Leverage Looker to create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide a holistic view of performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
Provide actionable insights to drive marketing strategy, optimize campaign performance, and improve customer acquisition and retention.
Collaborate with marketing & retention teams to understand their data needs, own and prioritize the roadmap, and deliver tailored insights and recommendations.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in both performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
Data Governance - ensure the data is flowing seamlessly between the website and third party tools, troubleshoot is necessary.


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Business, or similar). Master's degree is a plus.
2+ years in a Marketing Data & Insights role.
High proficiency with Looker and GA4.
High proficiency with Excel and Big Query.
Experience in e-commerce or consumer brands with a strong emphasis on customer acquisition and digital marketing.
Knowledge of DTC Marketing Analytics, A/B testing; familiarity with Python or SQL is a plus.
Strong data storytelling abilities, as well as the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience.
Inherent curiosity and analytical follow-through - you can’t help but ask “why?” and love using data and logic to explore potential solutions.


What We Offer


You will work with a dedicated, highly-engaged, international team of professionals who are passionate about helping couples and individuals start their families
We have a fast paced and collaborative work environment where we encourage open communication, ownership and independence
In addition to competitive salary we offer performance-based bonus system based on OKR
We provide professional development opportunities - training courses, workshops and seminars


Recruiting process

Step 1 ‘Screening call with HR’ - Step 2 ‘Assessment task’ - Step 3 ‘Interview with the Head of Growth’ - Step 4 ‘Final interview with CMO’
Show more
HTML:
About Mira

Mira is a San Francisco-based hormonal health company providing integrative care and hormonal testing for over 92,000 customers. In 2023, they were recognized by Inc. 5000 as America's fastest-growing femtech company. We started our company to help women and individuals reach their parenthood dreams and make their fertility journey smoother.

Mira’s most important breakthrough was inventing the market's only FDA-compliant at-home fertility monitor with quantitative technology. Since the beginning, they have been on a mission to develop data-driven hormonal health solutions to help women make confident health decisions during every stage of their lives—from the menstrual stage to menopause. Mira offers solutions to test, boost, and navigate fertility—starting from comprehensive hormone testing and supplements to fertility coaching and online courses.

We are committed to helping our customers achieve the highest possible success rates and outcomes; that is why our focus is on personalized care, the use of the most cutting-edge technology, and science-backed data.

About The Position

We are looking for a part-time Marketing Data Analyst **to enhance Mira’s decision-making processes through advanced data analysis and actionable insights. The ideal candidate is experienced in marketing analytics, e-commerce sector, and data visualization through Looker.

The role is a remote position, with a 20-hour workweek, flexible working hours and occasional overlap with the US team. There is potential for the role to evolve into a full-time position based on performance and company needs in 2-3 months.

If want to challenge yourself at a high-growth startup and make a difference for women's health please join us!

Responsibilities

  • Leverage Looker to create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide a holistic view of performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
  • Provide actionable insights to drive marketing strategy, optimize campaign performance, and improve customer acquisition and retention.
  • Collaborate with marketing & retention teams to understand their data needs, own and prioritize the roadmap, and deliver tailored insights and recommendations.
  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in both performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
  • Data Governance - ensure the data is flowing seamlessly between the website and third party tools, troubleshoot is necessary.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Business, or similar). Master's degree is a plus.
  • 2+ years in a Marketing Data & Insights role.
  • High proficiency with Looker and GA4.
  • High proficiency with Excel and Big Query.
  • Experience in e-commerce or consumer brands with a strong emphasis on customer acquisition and digital marketing.
  • Knowledge of DTC Marketing Analytics, A/B testing; familiarity with Python or SQL is a plus.
  • Strong data storytelling abilities, as well as the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience.
  • Inherent curiosity and analytical follow-through - you can’t help but ask “why?” and love using data and logic to explore potential solutions.

What We Offer

  • You will work with a dedicated, highly-engaged, international team of professionals who are passionate about helping couples and individuals start their families
  • We have a fast paced and collaborative work environment where we encourage open communication, ownership and independence
  • In addition to competitive salary we offer performance-based bonus system based on OKR
  • We provide professional development opportunities - training courses, workshops and seminars

Recruiting process

Step 1 ‘Screening call with HR’ - Step 2 ‘Assessment task’ - Step 3 ‘Interview with the Head of Growth’ - Step 4 ‘Final interview with CMO’

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

At Auctane, we are united by a passion to help businesses deliver — whatever their size, wherever they are, and however they operate. We make it possible for businesses to meet the ever-changing requirements of their industry and customer expectations. Auctane products enable hundreds of thousands of businesses to annually mail and ship billions of items — over $200 billion worth — to recipients around the globe.

The Auctane family of mailing and shipping software products includes ShipStation, Stamps.com, ShipStation API, Endicia, Metapack, GlobalPost, Packlink, and Return Rabbit. Our partners include Amazon, UPS, USPS, eBay, BigCommerce, Shopify, WooCommerce, and Walmart.

Our values

Win as One. Delight Customers. Deliver Great Outcomes.

About The Team

The Analytics team supports key business decision making through the delivery of actionable insights based on accurate data to stakeholders across the Auctane e-commerce products. These responsibilities are delivered through close collaboration with internal teams, working on the definition & refinement of the KPIs, setting goals against these KPIs, measuring performance against these goals and recommending (and when applicable, implementing) actions to drive improved performance. In addition, the Analytics team leads the delivery of both standardized & ad-hoc reporting, analysis & insights to drive business decisions.

About The Role

The Business Data Analyst at Auctane helps enable data-informed decision-making by developing reporting, performing analyses, and uncovering insights that support business growth, customer experience, and go-to-market execution. Working closely with senior analysts and cross-functional partners in Product, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success, this role focuses on supporting the development of dashboards, reports, and analyses that improve team visibility and decision-making. The role will contribute to strengthening Auctane's analytics capabilities by helping maintain data assets and collaborating with business teams to deliver impactful solutions.

What will you be doing?


Collaborate with engineering and business stakeholders to translate business needs into scalable, data-driven solutions while ensuring alignment and effective communication.
Generate actionable insights to support both strategic initiatives and day-to-day operational execution.
Design, develop, and maintain scalable reporting systems and dashboards, including tactical, strategic, and executive-level views that inform decision-making across Auctane brands.
Develop and maintain KPI reporting for core business areas such as Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success.
Define, implement, and manage key data feeds from internal systems and external partners to support accurate business performance measurement.
Work with large, complex datasets, ensuring data quality, accuracy, and consistency across the pipeline.
Participate in and lead analytic projects from problem definition through analysis to the clear presentation of results.
Promote adoption of analytics tools and reporting standards by delivering impactful reports, providing team training, and championing best practices.
Demonstrate a strategic mindset, simplifying complexity through innovative and scalable analytics solutions that address evolving business needs.


What are we looking for?


Two or more (2+) years experience in data-driven environments with an expert knowledge of SQL and translating complex datasets into clear business insights.
Experience designing and creating dashboards for use by Executives and Analysts.
Strong eye for detail and a passion for quickly delivering results for rapid action.
Comfortable working in a highly collaborative, consensus-oriented environment.
Excellent written, verbal, scientific communication and time management skills.
Data visualization and storytelling: ability to turn complex data into clear insights.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience, as well as the ability to design and deploy clear reporting assets.
Ability to work cross functionally to collaboratively understand and deliver on business needs.
English fluency is required


What will make you stand out?


Strong track record of learning new tools, technologies, and frameworks.
Experience with version control tools such as GitHub for collaborative analytics development.


What do we offer?

💸 Clear and transparent compensation plan. The salary range goes from 38000 to 45000€. We will discuss the indicated range with you in the first recruiting call to ensure that we are on the same page.

💰 Flexible salary benefits

Save on personal income tax with Cobee for expenses like transport, restaurants, and kindergarten.

🩺 Private health insurance

Free for all employees via Cigna, plus we cover 50% for your family members.

🏠 Remote-first culture

All Auctane Spain team members work remotely. We support your setup with a €50 net/month home office allowance (€600/year).

🌅 Generous time off

Enjoy 26 days of holiday per year (23 base days + your 🎂 birthday off, Christmas Eve, and New Year's Eve).

💻 Your gear, your choice

Whether you prefer Mac or Windows, or need an extra screen, we'll make sure you're set up for success from day one.

🗓️ Annual Salary Review

We're committed to recognizing your professional growth. Every year, we review salaries to reflect your individual development, achievements, and impact on our business success.

📙 Grow your skills

We offer up to €2000/year in training (certifications, conferences, workshops) to boost your growth—both technical and personal.

📺 Learning resources

Access internal and external training, including platforms like LinkedIn Learning, completely free.

🧘‍♂️ Holistic wellness program

Includes access to Wellhub, Curalinc (psychological support), Rocketlawyer (legal advice), and regular health webinars & challenges.

😊 Volunteer day

Take one day off a year to volunteer and give back. Bonus points for sharing pics on Slack!

👩‍⚕️ Free therapy vouchers

Because your mental health matters.

🏐 Health & wellness support

Get up to €55/month to cover your gym or fitness classes (yoga, boxing, pilates, etc.).

🗺️ Weekly language classes

Improve or learn a new language (English, Spanish, French, Italian, or German) in small groups with expert instructors—on us!

🏥 Time for health

Get 8 hours per year for personal medical appointments and 10 hours per year to support your family's medical needs.

⚖️ Work-life balance

We're flexible and people-first. We know life happens, and we aim to make work work for you.

🩳 Short Fridays

We work from 8:00 to 15:00 every Friday so you can start your weekend early.

🏖️ Summer Schedule

From mid-July through August, enjoy reduced summer hours to make the most of your summer.

💜 Inclusive, upbeat culture

No suits here—just a welcoming, casual, and respectful space where diversity is celebrated, and you can be your full self.

🌍 A global, multicultural team

We're made up of 20+ nationalities, speaking 10+ languages. All communication is in English, so everyone's included.

📦 Packlink Pro discount

Enjoy 99% off your personal shipments using our platform.

🔗 Referral bonuses

Know someone amazing? Earn €1K–€3K when you refer candidates we hire—depending on the role.

🏢 Central Madrid office

When you want a change of scenery, drop by our office in the heart of Madrid—free snacks and drinks included!

🏟️ Team events

We work hard and play hard with regular team-building activities and meetups.
Show more

Title: Mid Data Analyst - Marketing (f/m/x) - Spain
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Data Analyst to join our dynamic Marketing department at AUTO1 Group Technology. Our pioneering team of marketing experts leverages data-driven insights to run efficient performance marketing campaigns and enhance the customer journey. Operating all acquisition marketing and conversion optimization activities fully in-house provides you with the best environment for a steep learning curve. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform, revolutionizing the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

Job Description


Design, Develop, and Maintain our Reports : Work closely with the Marketing, Product, and Business Analytics teams of AUTO1 to enable faster and more insightful decision-making.
Provide stakeholders with data and business insights, follow up on KPIs definitions and implementation
Support Stakeholders with Data Access: Provide analysts and business stakeholders with easy access to well-structured data, fostering a data-driven culture.
Build and enhance data workflows, models and pipelines to support reporting and analytics needs in Tableau.
Ensure Data Quality and Consistency: Implement testing, documentation, and version control practices using Git to maintain high data quality standards.
Consolidate and review existing reports to lift our reporting to a higher level of information density.


Qualifications


Experience: 3+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, business intelligence, analytics engineering or other similar roles
Proficiency in SQL and Data Modeling, understanding of data modeling concepts for data warehousing. Understanding DBT is a plus.
Proficient in Tableau or similar business intelligence tools for data visualization.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and proactively drive projects to completion.
Preferred knowledge of marketing platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, etc.
Collaborative Mindset: Being a great team player comes naturally to you, and you communicate fluently in English.
Proactive Attitude: Highly motivated with a can-do mindset, willing to challenge the status quo and continuously seek improvement.


Additional Information


Education program for online courses, conferences, and training
Your life-work balance is important to us, so you have the option to work in a remote model.
Time to relax: 22 days of vacation per year
We offer discounts on well-known brands like Flaconi, Bosch, Apple, and Sky, as well as special offers on used cars for you, your family, and your friends
More than 90 different nationalities make up a truly international and diverse working environment


Contact

Igor Popov

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Junior Data Analyst en Ufinet 🌎
Description:
Modalidad: Híbrida

Localización: Madrid

Nivel de empleo: Profesional

Desde Candee, consultora de talento, estamos gestionando esta posición de Junior Data Analyst para Ufinet 🌎.

¿Qué es UFINET? 🔎

Ufinet es un operador mayorista de telecomunicaciones. Con más de 27 años de experiencia, ha desplegado más de 130.000 km de fibra óptica con una amplia cobertura de red en las principales ciudades de 17 países, principalmente de América Latina.

Pretenden proporcionar conectividad a través de fibra óptica de la manera más flexible y ágil, siempre con un alto compromiso con sus clientes.

Con valores integrados de flexibilidad, agilidad, pasión, compromiso o proximidad, tienen la visión de ser el operador neutral de telecomunicaciones de referencia a nivel mundial.

¿Qué hace que UFINET sea un sitio único? 😍

Según nos ha contado el equipo de UFINET, lo mejor de trabajar aquí es:

🤝Trabajo en equipo: Un ambiente de compañerismo, respeto y apoyo mutuo. Aquí todos reman en la misma dirección, se celebran los logros juntos y se superan los retos en equipo.

🌎 Crecimiento: UFINET es una empresa en plena expansión, lo que se traduce en oportunidades constantes para evolucionar profesionalmente.

💡Aprendizaje: Oportunidad de aprender constantemente nuevas tecnologías y habilidades dando soluciones a proyectos y problemas reales.

¿Cómo será tu equipo? 👯

Formarás parte del equipo de Software y Data, bajo el liderazgo de su Chief Data Officer. El equipo tiene una línea de Data Analysis y una línea de Data Engineering liderado por sus respectivos Team Leads y dentro de los cuáles los perfiles están especializados en las diferentes áreas de negocio.

Formarás parte del equipo de Data Analysts, quienes te acompañarán en tu desarrollo como analista de datos.

¿Cuál será tu misión? 🚀

Tu misión será dar soporte al equipo de analistas de datos y aprender y colaborar con todo lo necesario para realizar una visualización y análisis efectivo de datos.


Dar soporte en la extracción, limpieza y estructuración (ETL) de datos desde diferentes fuentes.
Participar en la construcción de informes que den respuesta a necesidades del equipo corporativo con Power Bi.
Construcción de conjuntos de datos consolidados de diferentes fuentes
Desarrollo de análisis descriptivos, analítica avanzada e implementación de modelos estadísticos.
Coordinarte con el equipo corporativo, para entender las necesidades del negocio y definir las métricas necesarias para un análisis de datos efectivo.
Colaborar con perfiles más seniors para aprender todo lo necesario para dominar la posición y crecer en la organización.


¿Qué están buscando? 🕵️‍♀️


Estudios en ingeniería, física o matemáticas.
Que tengas al menos una experiencia básica/intermedia laboral o en prácticas con SQL y algún lenguaje de programación como Python o Scala.
Que tengas curiosidad e interés por crecer en el mundo del dato.
Esperamos que seas una persona proactiva, flexible, con ganas de aprender y mejorar de manera continua junto con tu equipo.
Que seas una persona con buenas habilidades de comunicación, que sepa trabajar en equipo.
Permiso para trabajar en el país y dominio del español.


Valoraremos positivamente:


Que tengas experiencia con Power BI u otra herramienta de visualización de datos.
Que estés familiarizadx con la metodología Scrum y conozcas GitHub.
Te defiendas con el inglés (B2).


¿Qué ofrecen? 🍬


Modalidad híbrida de trabajo, con oficinas situadas en Paseo de la Castellana 47, Madrid.
Horario flexible: Entrada de 8h a 11h y horario de salida en consecuencia.
Mes de Agosto con Jornada Intensiva y Reducida.
Ticket Restaurant.
Seguro Médico con Adeslas.
Formación a demanda en función de tu interés/necesidades. Son una compañía abierta a sugerencias de formación, recursos y tecnología. No cuentan con restricciones en este aspecto.
Posibilidad de crecimiento profesional, donde estarás acompañado/a por un equipo técnico con ganas de compartir, enseñar y ayudarte a desarrollar todo tu potencial.


¿Cómo será tu proceso de selección? 📆


Antes de nada, aplica a la vacante 🙂.
Entrevista semi-estructurada: Si cumples los requisitos, tu Talent Agent se pondrá en contacto contigo para que puedas resolver dudas sobre la posición y para empezar a conocerte más allá de tu CV.
Caso práctico: En caso de que ambas partes consideréis que hay encaje, te enviaremos un caso práctico para que podamos verte en acción👩🏻‍💻.
Entrevista con Ufinet: Si has bordado el caso, agendaremos una entrevista con la compañía para que puedas entrevistar a tus potenciales empleadores y para que ellos puedan entrevistarte a ti.
Durante todo el proceso tendrás contacto directo con tu Talent Agent para poder resolver cualquier duda o inquietud.


Si has llegado hasta aquí, puedes ser la persona que buscamos. ¡Conectemos!

Desde Candee, Consultoría de Talento Digital, publicamos ofertas en diferentes portales mediante el uso de una plataforma propia. En ocasiones, algunos portales de empleo externos, como LinkedIn, pueden realizar cambios en algunas características de las posiciones como el "Nivel de empleo". Recomendamos solo considerar la información expresa en la descripción de la oferta o de los datos de nuestra propia página web.
Show more

¿Qué hace que UFINET sea un sitio único? 😍

Según nos ha contado el equipo de UFINET, lo mejor de trabajar aquí es:

🤝Trabajo en equipo: Un ambiente de compañerismo, respeto y apoyo mutuo. Aquí todos reman en la misma dirección, se celebran los logros juntos y se superan los retos en equipo.

🌎 Crecimiento: UFINET es una empresa en plena expansión, lo que se traduce en oportunidades constantes para evolucionar profesionalmente.

💡Aprendizaje: Oportunidad de aprender constantemente nuevas tecnologías y habilidades dando soluciones a proyectos y problemas reales.

¿Cómo será tu equipo? 👯

Formarás parte del equipo de Software y Data, bajo el liderazgo de su Chief Data Officer. El equipo tiene una línea de Data Analysis y una línea de Data Engineering liderado por sus respectivos Team Leads y dentro de los cuáles los perfiles están especializados en las diferentes áreas de negocio.

Formarás parte del equipo de Data Analysts, quienes te acompañarán en tu desarrollo como analista de datos.

¿Cuál será tu misión? 🚀

Tu misión será dar soporte al equipo de analistas de datos y aprender y colaborar con todo lo necesario para realizar una visualización y análisis efectivo de datos.

  • Dar soporte en la extracción, limpieza y estructuración (ETL) de datos desde diferentes fuentes.
  • Participar en la construcción de informes que den respuesta a necesidades del equipo corporativo con Power Bi.
  • Construcción de conjuntos de datos consolidados de diferentes fuentes
  • Desarrollo de análisis descriptivos, analítica avanzada e implementación de modelos estadísticos.
  • Coordinarte con el equipo corporativo, para entender las necesidades del negocio y definir las métricas necesarias para un análisis de datos efectivo.
  • Colaborar con perfiles más seniors para aprender todo lo necesario para dominar la posición y crecer en la organización.

¿Qué están buscando? 🕵️‍♀️

  • Estudios en ingeniería, física o matemáticas.
  • Que tengas al menos una experiencia básica/intermedia laboral o en prácticas con SQL y algún lenguaje de programación como Python o Scala.
  • Que tengas curiosidad e interés por crecer en el mundo del dato.
  • Esperamos que seas una persona proactiva, flexible, con ganas de aprender y mejorar de manera continua junto con tu equipo.
  • Que seas una persona con buenas habilidades de comunicación, que sepa trabajar en equipo.
  • Permiso para trabajar en el país y dominio del español.

Valoraremos positivamente:

  • Que tengas experiencia con Power BI u otra herramienta de visualización de datos.
  • Que estés familiarizadx con la metodología Scrum y conozcas GitHub.
  • Te defiendas con el inglés (B2).

¿Qué ofrecen? 🍬

  • Modalidad híbrida de trabajo, con oficinas situadas en Paseo de la Castellana 47, Madrid.
  • Horario flexible: Entrada de 8h a 11h y horario de salida en consecuencia.
  • Mes de Agosto con Jornada Intensiva y Reducida.
  • Ticket Restaurant.
  • Seguro Médico con Adeslas.
  • Formación a demanda en función de tu interés/necesidades. Son una compañía abierta a sugerencias de formación, recursos y tecnología. No cuentan con restricciones en este aspecto.
  • Posibilidad de crecimiento profesional, donde estarás acompañado/a por un equipo técnico con ganas de compartir, enseñar y ayudarte a desarrollar todo tu potencial.

¿Cómo será tu proceso de selección? 📆

  • Antes de nada, aplica a la vacante 🙂.
  • Entrevista semi-estructurada: Si cumples los requisitos, tu Talent Agent se pondrá en contacto contigo para que puedas resolver dudas sobre la posición y para empezar a conocerte más allá de tu CV.
  • Caso práctico: En caso de que ambas partes consideréis que hay encaje, te enviaremos un caso práctico para que podamos verte en acción👩🏻‍💻.
  • Entrevista con Ufinet: Si has bordado el caso, agendaremos una entrevista con la compañía para que puedas entrevistar a tus potenciales empleadores y para que ellos puedan entrevistarte a ti.
  • Durante todo el proceso tendrás contacto directo con tu Talent Agent para poder resolver cualquier duda o inquietud.

Si has llegado hasta aquí, puedes ser la persona que buscamos. ¡Conectemos!

Desde Candee, Consultoría de Talento Digital, publicamos ofertas en diferentes portales mediante el uso de una plataforma propia. En ocasiones, algunos portales de empleo externos, como LinkedIn, pueden realizar cambios en algunas características de las posiciones como el "Nivel de empleo". Recomendamos solo considerar la información expresa en la descripción de la oferta o de los datos de nuestra propia página web.

Title: Data & insights Intern
Description:
We’re looking for a Data & Insights intern to join our Global eCommerce team of Consumer Business, as part of our digital marketing operations team in Madrid.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

As an Insights intern you’ll be responsible for supporting the data and insights team with data analysis in their day to day for our Consumer brands.

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

What You’ll Do


Understand our business and its processes through our data and apply it to help product and services teams
Create and maintain new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintain and create new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Monthly/Weekly and ad-hoc market analysis and reporting, monitoring the performance of our brand across different markets. Monitor also to competitors and monitoring the news of competing brands.


Your Qualifications


Be a champion in Microsof office (excel and powerpoint mainly)
Have a structured way of working, understand complex processes, and able to explain them in a simple way
Conduct end-to-end analysis and communicate insights effectively
Desired would be experience creating dashboards (with tools like Tableau/PowerBI/Looker etc.)
Eager to learn
Fluent in English


What You’ll Get In Return…

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!
Show more

Title: BI Data Analytics Graduate
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
We are looking for talented and passionate graduates within Technology that are interested in an international Tech Graduate Program for one year, you will deep dive into different parts of the business, where you will have the opportunity to experience a global project in an international company.




To summarize, if you have a technical profile and are interested in Technology, there is no doubt you can fit into our organization and learn and grow your experience!




Our Technology Graduate Program is designed to equip recent graduates with the essential skills and knowledge needed to excel in the dynamic field of technology. This intensive program offers a comprehensive combination of hands-on experience, technical training, and professional development opportunities.




Program Highlights:

Practical Projects: Graduates will work on real-world projects under the guidance of experienced mentors. These projects will provide hands-on experience and help develop problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Technical Training: The program includes specialized training sessions on the latest technologies, programming languages, and tools. Participants will have the opportunity to obtain industry-recognized certifications.
Professional Development: In addition to technical skills, the program focuses on developing soft skills such as communication, teamwork, and leadership. Workshops and seminars will be conducted to enhance these competencies.
Mentorship and Networking: Each participant will be paired with a mentor who will provide guidance and support throughout the program. Networking events will also be organized to help graduates connect with industry professionals and peers.
Assessment and Feedback: Regular performance evaluations will be conducted to provide constructive feedback and identify areas for improvement. This ensures continuous development and growth throughout the program.
Career Opportunities: The diverse experience gained during the program will adequately prepare them for various positions in the technology industry.




Responsibilities

The graduate will join different teams inside Data & Analytics in a rotation program that can help him/her to give a global view of the data activities in the company. Among others, will do the following tasks

Participate in different projects in the Data & Analytics teams:
IA projects in the Advance Analytics domain as AIOPs engineer
Data & Structural projects in the Development domain as Data Engineer
Data Governance activities
Take part of the delivery team for go-live tasks
Take part of the support team for different services both in AI and Data Services
Manage the communication with different stakeholders
Document and publish every task relate to his/her work




Requirements

Bachelor or master’s in Computer science, Software Engineering, telecommunications, or similar.
Fluent in English and Spanish.
Graduation Certificate.




Preferred

Previous international exposure
1 year of work experience or other internships are meriting.







Verisure will offer you:

Hybrid model 🏢 💻 Work from home and at our great Madrid offices in Pozuelo de Alarcón (El Barrial- Centro Comercial)
Lunch included at our canteen 🍽️ You won’t need to pay for your daily meal when you are at the office! :)
Dynamic and vibrant environment 💥Our office is an open-plan space in which you will be able to interact with the best professional from different teams at all levels.
Periodic team buildings! 💪 Because it’s important to have fun!
Learning and training programs




At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gamdom is home to thousands of betting options for both sports and casino players to wager on. Since 2016, we have been steadily growing to provide more than just casino games and sports betting events to enjoy; With us, you can enjoy unique bonuses and earn massive rewards simultaneously. Discover all the rewarding features Gamdom can offer you below.

Gamdom is seeking a Data Analyst with strong technical skills to join our fast-paced data team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of analytics, engineering, and visualization. You'll bring hands-on experience in SQL, Snowflake, and dbt, along with business-facing skills in reporting, dashboard development (using Tableau), and data analysis to drive insights across the company.

The successful candidate will analyze existing reporting logic, collaborate with data engineers to design robust data models and data marts, and build scalable, high-impact Tableau dashboards. You will also support the transition of reports and dashboards to our new Snowflake environment and provide actionable insights to stakeholders across finance, CRM, marketing, and operations.

We’re looking for someone who is independent, proactive, and adaptable—comfortable managing their workload, collaborating across teams, and driving solutions forward with minimal supervision. The ideal candidate is passionate about analytics, confident in SQL and data modeling, and experienced in working alongside engineers and analysts to translate business needs into technical solutions.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze SQL queries in Tableau and Snowflake datasets to extract key KPIs, metrics, and business logic.
Collaborate with data engineers to build robust reporting data models and data marts in Snowflake.
Act as a bridge between stakeholders and data engineering—gathering requirements, clarifying business definitions, and ensuring accurate metric implementation.
Design, develop, and optimize Tableau dashboards aligned with business needs and performance standards.
Support the migration of reports and dashboards to the new Snowflake environment.
Conduct data analysis to generate actionable insights for finance, CRM, marketing, and operations teams.
Clearly communicate new data models and metrics to BI and data analysts to ensure adoption and consistency.
Provide support for ad hoc data analyses, reporting requests, and broader data initiatives.
Contribute to data governance by documenting definitions, processes, and ensuring consistency across the organization.
Assist in advanced analytics initiatives, such as fraud detection, customer segmentation, churn analysis, and performance tracking.


Required Skills & Competencies


2–4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within the casino, iGaming, or online entertainment industry.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience with Snowflake and dbt (or similar tools) for data modeling and ETL.
Proficiency in Tableau or similar BI tools (e.g., Power BI), including dashboard design and optimization.
Solid understanding of SQL-based data modeling, warehousing principles, and KPI frameworks.
Ability to work independently, manage competing priorities, and proactively solve problems.
Strong analytical mindset with excellent attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with tools like Jira for backlog and task management (a plus).
Understanding of data privacy considerations in analytics.
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field (preferred).


Why Join Us


Work with a talented, collaborative team on meaningful, high-impact projects.
Help shape the future of analytics in a fast-growing, innovative company.
Gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge cloud data platforms and tools.
Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and strong opportunities for professional growth.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

¿Quienes somos?

Alter Solutions es una compañía de consultoría de tecnologías de la información y un catalizador de la transformación digital. Somos un equipo, una comunidad, un grupo de personas con un objetivo común: crecer y hacer crecer a la compañía.

Job Description

¿Qué buscamos?

Un perfil Data Analyst con experiencia de al menos 4 años con algunas de las siguientes tecnologías:


Power BI
Azure Data Factory
Azure Databricks
DAX


Additional Information

¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?


Modalidad de trabajo: Totalmente remota.
Trabajar en un cliente internacional.
Salarios competitivos con el mercado.
Crecimiento profesional.
Participar en proyectos internacionales.
Re-ubicación en otros países.

Un perfil Data Analyst con experiencia de al menos 4 años con algunas de las siguientes tecnologías:

  • Power BI
