Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Department: People Tech & Development

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: German Korenblum

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save by reshaping their relationship with money. We’re the region’s leading Buy Now, Pay Later solution, trusted by millions of shoppers and thousands of brands like Amazon, IKEA, and Shein.

We’re a team of bold thinkers and doers, building a category-defining fintech across MENA—and we’re just getting started.

We’re looking for a data-savvy problem solver to join our People team as an HR Data Analyst. If you love making sense of data, spotting trends, and turning insights into impact—this one’s for you.

At Tabby, our people are at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you’ll help us understand, measure, and improve the entire employee experience—from hiring to retention and everything in between.

🔍 What You’ll Be Doing


Build and maintain clear, insightful dashboards and reports across the employee lifecycle.
Dig into HR data (think: hiring, attrition, engagement, performance) and find the stories behind the numbers.
Partner with HR, Finance, and Leadership to support strategic workforce planning and decision-making.
Track key HR metrics (time-to-hire, attrition, headcount growth, DEI stats, etc.) and flag trends early.
Ensure data quality across our HR systems, and help streamline and automate reporting workflows.
Run deep-dive analyses and present findings in a way that drives action, not just information.
Be our go-to person for all things HR analytics.



🧠 What You’ll Bring


2–4 years of experience in HR analytics, people operations, or a related data role.
You’re fluent in spreadsheets (Excel or Google Sheets) and can tell a story with numbers.
Hands-on experience with HR systems (HRIS, ATS), BigQuery, and visualization tools ( Looker, Power BI, etc.).
A natural curiosity and sharp eye for spotting patterns, gaps, and opportunities.
Clear communication skills—you can turn complex findings into simple narratives.
Bonus points if you’ve worked in a startup, tech, or fintech environment.



💡 Why You’ll Love Working at Tabby


You’ll be part of a fast-growing team where ideas move fast and your work truly matters.
You’ll help shape how data drives people strategy in a company where culture is everything.
We offer competitive compensation, flexibility, and a no-BS, high-trust environment.
You’ll join a smart, international team that’s curious, humble, and obsessed with building something great.

HTML:
Department: People Tech & Development

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: German Korenblum

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save by reshaping their relationship with money. We’re the region’s leading Buy Now, Pay Later solution, trusted by millions of shoppers and thousands of brands like Amazon, IKEA, and Shein.

We’re a team of bold thinkers and doers, building a category-defining fintech across MENA—and we’re just getting started.

We’re looking for a data-savvy problem solver to join our People team as an HR Data Analyst. If you love making sense of data, spotting trends, and turning insights into impact—this one’s for you.

At Tabby, our people are at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you’ll help us understand, measure, and improve the entire employee experience—from hiring to retention and everything in between.

🔍 What You’ll Be Doing

  • Build and maintain clear, insightful dashboards and reports across the employee lifecycle.
  • Dig into HR data (think: hiring, attrition, engagement, performance) and find the stories behind the numbers.
  • Partner with HR, Finance, and Leadership to support strategic workforce planning and decision-making.
  • Track key HR metrics (time-to-hire, attrition, headcount growth, DEI stats, etc.) and flag trends early.
  • Ensure data quality across our HR systems, and help streamline and automate reporting workflows.
  • Run deep-dive analyses and present findings in a way that drives action, not just information.
  • Be our go-to person for all things HR analytics.


🧠 What You’ll Bring

  • 2–4 years of experience in HR analytics, people operations, or a related data role.
  • You’re fluent in spreadsheets (Excel or Google Sheets) and can tell a story with numbers.
  • Hands-on experience with HR systems (HRIS, ATS), BigQuery, and visualization tools ( Looker, Power BI, etc.).
  • A natural curiosity and sharp eye for spotting patterns, gaps, and opportunities.
  • Clear communication skills—you can turn complex findings into simple narratives.
  • Bonus points if you’ve worked in a startup, tech, or fintech environment.


💡 Why You’ll Love Working at Tabby

  • You’ll be part of a fast-growing team where ideas move fast and your work truly matters.
  • You’ll help shape how data drives people strategy in a company where culture is everything.
  • We offer competitive compensation, flexibility, and a no-BS, high-trust environment.
  • You’ll join a smart, international team that’s curious, humble, and obsessed with building something great.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.

Your main activies are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders.


Behavioral Skills

Profile and skills to success


Ability to synthetize/simplify: Expert
Communication skills - oral & written: Expert
Ability to deliver/Results driven: Expert


Transversal Skills


Analytical Ability: Expert
Ability to manage a project: Proficient


Business Skills


Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics - Business Analytics: Expert


Languages


English (Fluent)


Tools and Methodologies


DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Expert)
DATABASE MANAGEMENT MICROSOFT SQL Server (Expert)


Experience, Academic Background & Other Qualifications

Field of Expertise


Data Analytics ([3 - 4] years)


Academic Background


Masters in Mathematics and Statistics
Masters in Information Technology and Computer Science


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: STDA Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Stress Testing Data Analytics (STDA) team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for the BNP Paribas Group. The team is responsible for the elaboration of the dataset that will be used as the starting point for modelling activities and stress testing exercises, which are crucial in granting the Group means to anticipate risks
The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) is used as an end-user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines. Data visualization is also a part of the team’s responsibilities, with Tableau as the main tool
The team works in partnership with the IT department of the Group regarding the stress-testing platform. They support the team on a daily-basis and help with back-end big data engineering support and maintenance
In this role, you will join the team dedicated to credit risk. Your primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, present data to see beyond the numbers and prepare the databases used for the projection of credit risk parameters for stress testing and IFRS 9


Your Main Activities Are


Perform data collection and build/maintain reliable data pipelines
Work on data ingestion, data quality, data preparation, data cleaning and data analysis
Perform data consolidation in a strong control and analyses framework
Build and optimize the data processing, being in charge of sourcing and connecting data
Develop dynamic and intelligent dashboards
Work closely with our data providers and with our clients
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises


Profile and Skills to Success


Master Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Information Technology / Data Analytics / Engineering or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Data exploration and data preparation
SQL
Python
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to deliver/Results driven
Ability to work with tight deadlines and multidisciplinary teams
Analytical ability
Attention to detail / rigor
Communication skills, both written and oral
Resilience

Title: Analytic Consultant
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are currently searching for a Analytic Consultant for the Intelligence Analytics (iA) – Price & Promotion Team.

You will work together with some of the largest FMCG companies, helping them to make the right choices for their price and promo strategy, considering the impact on sales and P&L.

You will manage the Price and Promo projects, working together with the executive teams, analyzing the outputs of the projects, and providing insightful price and promo recommendations.

Your insights will influence decisions for some of today’s leading global companies.

You will have the opportunity to be part of the PnP NielsenIQ service transformation.

Responsibilities


Be part of an international project team that helps FMCG clients optimizing their pricing and promotion activities – cover Clients in Europe, Middle East, and Africa
Convert analytical results into a business-focused and actionable client report
Use Nielsen tools and methodologies to build answers to business questions based on the market data and revenue management analysis
Deliver insights and recommendations to the client in a presentation
Coordinate project execution between NIQ teams of experts


Qualifications


Minimum Bachelor’s degree with a preference to Business, Economics or Mathematics
2-3 year’s previous FMCG / research or consulting agency experience would be a plus
Strong analytical skills and numerical reasoning
Strong organizational, communication & interpersonal skills
Focused on helping the client win in the market
Ability to travel to deliver insights and recommendations presentations
Strong Business English knowledge, both verbal and written (another European Language would be an asset);


WHAT DO WE OFFER?

Besides an attractive salary & compensation package, NIQ offers flexible working hours and working from home, helping you to create a work/life balance that fits the best for your personal situation. Moreover, you will experience a dynamic, open, international and solution-oriented environment. You will be trained on-the-job to develop your skills and experience.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

About The Job

  • The Data Analyst main mission is to create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management

Your Main Activities Are

  • Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
  • Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
  • Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
  • Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
  • Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Masters in Mathematics and Statistics or Information Technology and Computer Science
  • Up to 2 years of professional experience in Data Analytics
  • Proficiency of Data Viz Blending Analytics Tableau, Power BI and SQL
  • Fluent in English
  • Good communication skills with the ability to synthetize and simplify
  • Analytical ability and ability to deliver and results driven

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

    • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
    • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
    • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Join Us at Closer Consulting!

Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation – we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home. We provide our people with the means, opportunities, and support they need to thrive and innovate. ✨

For this position, it is necessary to have a residence in Lisbon, PT.

We seek a Data Analyst professional who is willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid project.

What You'll Be Doing


Design and maintain business dashboards and impactful data visualizations
Analyze large and complex datasets to support strategic and operational decisions
Build and optimize data pipelines using Airflow, SQL, and Python
Ensure data quality and consistency across referential sources ✅
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand needs and deliver insights
Support continuous improvement of data processes and analytical tools
Work in Agile teams and contribute to the evolution of third-party data ecosystems ⚙️☁️


What We're Looking For


6+ years of experience in data analysis, functional/technical specification, and data modeling
Advanced skills in SQL, Python, and PySpark
Experience with Oracle databases (SQL Server/PostgreSQL is a plus)
Proficiency with Power BI, Tableau, or other visualization tools
Familiarity with Airflow for pipeline orchestration ⏱️
Experience in Data Warehousing and file formats like Parquet
Ability to work with APIs and knowledge of Git is a plus
Solid grasp of Agile methodologies (SCRUM)


Soft Skills That Matter


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and stakeholder management ️
Proactivity, autonomy, and adaptability
Attention to detail and ability to synthesize information
Team spirit and client orientation


Languages

English – Fluent (preferred)

French – Intermediate (nice to have)

Portuguese – Fluent (mandatory)

Nice To Have


Knowledge of referential data and banking domain (consumer credit)
Tools like Jira, Confluence, and Draw.IO for documentation and collaboration


We Believe We Are The Ones To


Providing a multidisciplinary Team
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth
Providing you with a custom training plan
Helping you reach happiness


Oh… And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects
Stimulating teams and leaders
World-class Clients and Partners


If you enjoy turning data into business-driving decisions, we'd like to talk to you. Send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and discover the closer side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

Title: Risk Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK is to provide Senior Management of the Group and of the Operating Divisions, with full transparency and dynamic analysis of the risk and clients managed by Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) and Investment Solutions (IS) business units. RISK contributes to the definition of the Group’s risk appetite, its risk decision-making process and the optimization of capital allocation to support the development of the Operating Divisions
RISK Systems team is part of RISK. Its mission consists in providing the Bank with a comprehensive capital markets risk system used to calculate market and counterparty risk capital figures using advanced methods and to support the needs of users for risk analysis, risk reporting and the credit process. In this context, RISK Systems Operations team is a global team responsible for the production of market and counterparty risk metrics to the RISK function
Operations team is in charge of functional support on market and counterparty risk systems of the bank. The team in Portugal is focusing in particular on the quality aspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues are resolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) about data quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, and assisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs are discussed
The mission of Operations team is met by:
Ensuring clients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of the services provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningful KPIs about our main services
Resolution of incidents related to data quality, what regularly involves investigation and coordination with other teams
Running, streamlining, documenting existing processes and improving them once we detect any opportunities to do so
The role is for a position within the Operations team in Lisbon, Portugal


Your Main Activities Are


Work on Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance and monitoring Indicators about the availability and quality of the data in our systems, and maintaining these KPIs
Investigate issues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently
Build close links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients
Provide training and guidance to new users of the system where required


Profile and Skills to Success


Master’s Degree in Business / Finance / Mathematics / IT or related
Years of relevant experience
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
MS Office Pack (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
SQL
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to deliver / results driven
Organisational skills
Proactivity

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data & BI Developer
Description:
A SynchroTech

recruta um Data Engineer (Databricks) para uma empresa cliente, premiada, especializada em projetos de consultoria e outsourcing em IT, em Lisboa.

FUNÇÃO


Engenharia de dados em ambiente Microsoft Azure.
Desenho e implementação de modelos de dados complexos.
Integração de dados com ferramentas analíticas (incluindo Microsoft Fabric e Power BI).
Automação e orquestração de pipelines com Azure Data Factory e Azure DevOps.
Apoio a análises avançadas com Python e Databricks.
Interpretação de requisitos do negócio bancário e conformidade regulatória.


LOCAL E HORÁRIO


Lisboa.
40h semanais.
Regime híbrido (3x no escritório, por semana).


REQUISITOS


Mínimo de 3 anos de experiência como Data Engineer.
Experiência com Azure Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Data Factory e DevOps.
Bons conhecimentos de Python.
Domínio de Power BI, Power Query e DAX.
Experiência em modelação de dados e integração de dados analíticos.
Certificações Microsoft (ex: Azure Data Engineer, Power BI Data Analyst) são valorizadas.
Conhecimento do setor bancário e das suas regulamentações.


CONDIÇÕES


Contrato de trabalho estável.
Benefícios competitivos.
Formação profissional credenciada e mentoring contínuo.
Gestão de talento personalizada, com foco na progressão de carreira e aconselhamento.
Seguro de Saúde.


Os candidatos interessados devem submeter o CV atualizado.

SynchroTech by Egor

Success through People

Os candidatos considerados serão contactados num prazo máximo de 10 dias úteis.

Title: Data Documentalist / Data Governance
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Support the build-up of Data Catalog, enhancing the completeness and accuracy of Data Dictionary, Business Glossary, Data Lineage, Data Classification and Governance.


Essential Skills


At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
Experience of reading technical documentation for systems;
Experience of creating data dictionaries, business glossaries and data governance models;
Good knowledge of Python and SQL;
Good knowledge of English.


What Do I Need Before I Apply


The candidate must be resident in Portugal.

  • 2 anos de experiência profissional em Power BI;
  • Conhecimentos de SQL;
  • Valorizamos autonomia, proatividade e motivação para trabalhar em equipa;
  • Bons conhecimentos da língua inglesa;
  • Disponibilidade para projeto híbrido em Lisboa

Se reúnes estas condições e gostarias de integrar uma organização inovadora, que aposta continuamente na formação dos seus talentos, envia-nos a tua candidatura.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

Title: Senior Full Stack Data Analyst
Description:
Intro

At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation – which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

About The Role

We're looking for a Senior Full Stack Data Analyst to join our growing analytics team. You’ll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your data expertise & insight generations will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What will you be doing

As a Senior Full Stack Data Analyst, you will:


Building end-to-end analytics solutions, using data modelling, analytics techniques and data visualisation to power Pleo
Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What you bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced data practitioner with a dual background in analytics and analytics engineering within a fast-paced environment, preferably fintech
Possess expert technical skills and experience with tools such as advanced SQL, dbt, BigQuery, Looker (and LookML)
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Like to be involved in both engineering excellent products and understanding business and product challenges with analytics.
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail
Are highly familiar with CI/CD processes and understand their importance in maintaining data integrity


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, and London offices, or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Quant Research AI
Description:
Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with our GM Data and AI Lab teams to design, implement, and optimize AI solutions for various projects
Conduct independent research to identify opportunities for leveraging AI technology within the Markets 360 investment research domain
Contribute to the development of systematic and industrialized AI solutions to enhance investment strategies
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of AI technologies into our existing infrastructure
Stay updated on the latest AI advancements and industry trends to continuously improve our Markets 360 research efforts


Profile And Skills To Success


Master’s degree in a numeric subject with understanding of economics and markets (eg.: Economics with a speciality in Econometrics, Finance, Computer Science, Applied Maths, Engineering, Physics)
Knowledge of key concepts in Statistics and Mathematics such as Probability Theory, Inference, and Linear Algebra
Programming skills in Python and knowledge of common numerical and machine-learning packages (NumPy, scikit-learn, pandas, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing AI solutions, with a focus on large language models and natural language processing
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to manage projects efficiently, including planning, execution, and monitoring
Understanding of the financial industry and investment research, including relevant regulations and compliance requirements


About The Team

Markets 360 is made up of around 100 economists, strategists and analysts across the Americas, Western Europe, CEEMEA and Asia Pacific, who work closely together to create cross-asset perspectives.

With a focus on value-added research and thought leadership, the aim is to publish clear, timely and thought-provoking pieces on topics ranging from financial and economic forecasts to in-depth analysis of particular assets, economies and themes.

The GM Data and AI Lab team is a small team of data scientists applying the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Data modelling and Natural Language Processing to strategic projects for the business.

This role will be in Portugal, working alongside the AI Lab and the Markets 360 teams based across the globe.

About Global Markets

Global Markets is BNP Paribas’ capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutional, corporate, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning…)

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.

Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA – Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile And Skills To Success


Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
Up to 3 years of relevant experience
Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)


#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: OPC Reporting and Automation - Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Global Markets Operational and Permanent Control (GM OPC) set-up faces increasing Regulatory and Conduct demands beyond pure Operational Risk. As part of Strategy Conduct and Risk (SCR), GM OPC operates over the 3 main regions, through the three following Practices:


Regulatory Practice: support any regulatory requirement with a sustainable framework, in line with the dedicated Governance, Control Plan & Risk Assessment
Conduct Practice: assess and challenge the effectiveness of the Conduct control set-up as well as ensure a full convergence between Conduct Risk Identification (CRI), Risk and Control Self-Assessment – RCSA).
Operational Risk Practice: contribute to protect the business (P&L, reputation)


The three Practices are further supported by three transversal Streams – Protection (Management and monitoring of incidents, remediation actions and recommendations), Prevention (Deploying RCSA and contribute to Operational risk computation) and Supervision (Validation process and Coordinating the internal control Governance and other Regulatory-based committees).

Your Main Activities Are


Support the team to produce regular reporting on the main operational risk indicators, and proactively suggest improvements on the reports;
Use different tools to collect and analyze data, as well as structuring queries and performing routine maintenance of reports;
Perform trend analysis comparison to previous weeks/months/quarters
Proactively suggest improvements on reports on a continuous basis and promote digital solutions
Ensure data input & quality check;
Support the execution of governance committees and presentations
Support the OPC team with Ad-Hoc requests (Statistics; Kpis; presentations; etc.)
Liaise & Interact with OPC teams worldwide


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor, Post-Graduation or Master Degree in Data Science; Management, Finance, Science, Maths;
Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, VBA, Power BI, (other languages would be a plus)
Analytical and quantitative skills, Precision, rigorousness;
Excellent organizational skills
Team spirit, ability to work with others;
Ability to communicate clearly in both oral and written form (English);
Experience in investment banking is an advantage.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

The Global Markets Operational and Permanent Control (GM OPC) set-up faces increasing Regulatory and Conduct demands beyond pure Operational Risk. As part of Strategy Conduct and Risk (SCR), GM OPC operates over the 3 main regions, through the three following Practices:

Title: Global Insights Senior Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) will be home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP will offer rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Commercial Analytics Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

The Global Commercial Insights team at Amgen plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Global Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving global commercial strategy. As a Global Insights Senior Associate, you will support development of global analytical tools and capabilities that enable Global Insights teams to leverage secondary data to derive insights and help accelerate business decisions to support products and pipeline assets across therapy areas. Additionally, you will assist in landscape research across therapy areas and disease states to support global commercial deliverables including brand planning, opportunity assessments, global performance tracking, etc.

The individual in this role must be willing to solve ambiguous problems by leveraging both technical and consultative skills sets

Responsibilities will include:


Design, implement, and optimize global analytical tools and frameworks that enable Global Insights teams to extract insights from secondary data, supporting data-driven decision-making.
Build secondary data analytics toolbox to train and guide the Global Insights teams to efficiently use secondary data for insights generation for several global commercial deliverables.
Build ETL processes (Extract, Transform, & Load) for several data sources, analyze patterns and trends, and develop data models to support business needs.
Design systems for data storage, processing, and integration while ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Design, build, and maintain interactive Tableau/Power BI reports & dashboards with AI-driven analytics, troubleshoot issues, and optimize performance.
Ensure clear documentation for reports, dashboards, caveats, and processes for long-term usability.
Explore new data sources, methodologies, and visualization techniques (including AI-based techniques and methodologies) to enhance insights generation and increase the impact of secondary analytics in decision-making influencing global commercial strategy across portfolio.
Utilize syndicated and real-world data sources (e.g., IQVIA, claims data, epidemiology data) to generate dashboards for key metrics across diseases.
Conduct landscape assessments across multiple therapy areas and disease states, identifying key market trends and unmet needs to support global commercial deliverables.
Set priorities, develop and manage multiple projects and timelines simultaneously.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


Minimum 3 years of experience in Pharma/Biotech analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
OR Master’s degree and 3 years of analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
OR Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
University Degree in data science, commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel and PowerPoint knowledge


Preferred Requirements:


Familiarity with technologies and applications, and hands-on experience to analyze, synthesize, and integrate various secondary data
Knowledge in data, analytics, research, and/or dashboarding & reporting approach
Experience with commonly used biopharmaceutical industry secondary datasets and databases
A keen eye for design, with the ability to develop compelling Power BI and Tableau dashboards
Ability to write and execute SQL queries to extract and manipulate data
Skilled in tools like Tableau, Python, and PowerBI
Knowledge of AI and ability to integrate AI-based solutions in workflow / dashboard / tools / analytics
Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and draw meaningful conclusions
Ability to identify and resolve technical issues
Knowledge of modern cloud-based warehouse technologies such as Snowflake, Amazon Redshift is preferred
Ability to drive implementation to enhance methodologies and standard processes in secondary data analytics
Strong oral and written presentation skills, with ability to explain complex concepts verbally or visually via PowerPoint / Excel
Evident project management skills—able to manage multiple, simultaneous projects and data sources
Understanding of the Bio-Pharmaceutical and biotech industry trends and operations
Ability to work collaboratively in team-based environment


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

  • Evident project management skills—able to manage multiple, simultaneous projects and data sources
  • Understanding of the Bio-Pharmaceutical and biotech industry trends and operations
  • Ability to work collaboratively in team-based environment

THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us

  • Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
  • Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
  • Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
  • Flexible work arrangements.

APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master’s degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products – either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you’re looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let´s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.
Show more
