Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Description

Who is Defined.ai? Well, from a technical point of view, we leverage the power of a global crowd to provide some of the world’s biggest companies with the high-quality data they need to power their artificial intelligence. We’re instrumental to the progression and development of artificial intelligence and we couldn’t be prouder or more inspired to be involved in an industry that is changing the world.

From a personal point of view, we’re a group of big thinkers, high achievers and creative problem solvers. We bond over our shared love of software engineering, data science, and strong coffee. We like online gaming, running marathons, and team drinks. We celebrate authenticity and diversity and we’re invested in what we do. Our mission? World domination, obviously!

What will you do?

  • Design and implement scalable PySpark-based data pipelines to process (clean, validate, package and deliver) multimodal AI training datasets (e.g., text, audio, video, images, etc.);
  • Develop ETL pipelines to fuel the Operations areas with data for their analytical dashboards;
  • Set software engineering tools, platforms, and best practices while performing trade-off analysis to best match engineering, product, and project constraints and expectations;
  • Operate data pipelines to ingest data from multiple sources, and deliver it to different destinations.
  • Help the Product Manager and stakeholders in structuring, breaking down, and prioritizing the product roadmap into backlog work items;
  • Collaborate with other software engineering teams such as SREs and DevOps to achieve your team’s goals;
  • Work together with Software Engineering teams so as to integrate the Data Platform with other tools and platforms.

Who are we looking for?

Do you have the drive to work in an innovative and ambitious environment?

We’re looking for someone with a determined and proactive mindset, someone inspired and passionate to help us achieve our goals. Our successful candidate is a strong critical thinker, reliable and transparent, with an ability to learn and communicate. We are looking for someone special to contribute to our unique culture.

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science or similar background;
  • Experience in PySpark-based data pipelines and software quality best practices;
  • Worked with Azure services such as Synapse Analytics (mainly PySpark Jobs, Pipelines, and Notebooks), ADLS, Power BI, DevOps, and SQL and NoSQL databases;
  • Solid understanding of data-related architectures, concepts, technologies, and processes (e.g., Medallion, Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, ETL, etc.);
  • Comfortable with evaluating and applying software design and architectural patterns/principles;
  • Knowledge of RESTful APIs based on FastAPI, from the provider as well as the consumer point of view;
  • Problem Solving skills;
  • Proficient in both written and spoken English.

Benefits

You spend a lot of your time at work, so it should be challenging, fun and interesting. At Defined.ai it will be all of those things and more. Here’s what we offer:

  • Flexible working schedule and hybrid model. We know comfort can boost creativity and performance, so you can manage your schedule and work both from one of our modern office spaces or home.
  • Excellent career development opportunities in a high growth company. With us, you can accomplish your career goals and follow a well-described career path with the support of your supervisor.
  • Culture of feedback and continuous improvement. AI is a fast-paced area, so we keep track of tech trends, and we always ask for feedback.
  • An international and diverse team. We have more than 30 nationalities at our 3 locations, and we provide language classes.
  • Continuous training opportunities. You can choose from many options: leveraging hand-on workshops, unlimited access to Udemy and formal development opportunities.
  • We love to have fun together. We joke a lot, and we can't imagine work without fun activities – we already surfed, raced carts and played soccer together.

About Us

Defined.ai offers a platform with multiple data delivery options that leverages machine learning technology and human intelligence to deliver quality-guaranteed training data for AI systems. The platform offers self-service and fully customizable solutions that deliver high-quality project-specific training data, enabling AI products reach market quicker. It is this business model that has allowed Defined.ai to raise a total of $63.6M in funding over 4 rounds. Our value proposition is quality, privacy, speed and scale, covering more than 50 different languages. With strong expertise in speech and natural language processing technologies, we have been serving AI companies and Fortune 500 companies since day one. Defined.ai was founded in Seattle and has offices in Lisbon and Porto.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? 🚀🌍

At TEKEVER, we lead innovation in Europe as the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation.

💻 Digital | 🛡️ Defence | 🔒 Security | 🛰️ Space

We operate across four strategic areas, combining artificial intelligence, systems engineering, data science, and aerospace technology to tackle global challenges — from protecting people and critical infrastructure to exploring space.

We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that delivers real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. Our products and services support strategic and operational decisions in the most demanding environments — whether at sea, on land, in space, or in cyberspace.

🌐 Become part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary, and mission-driven team that is transforming maritime surveillance and redefining global safety standards.

At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to empower critical decision-making.

If you're passionate about technology and eager to shape the future — TEKEVER is the place for you. 👇🏻🎯

Mission

As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building and maintaining the data pipelines and systems that support our data-driven initiatives, as well as supporting the evolution of our Data & Analytics Platform. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to ensure that our data & AI infrastructure is robust, scalable and efficient. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in data integration, ETL processes, database management and Data & Analytics Platform development.

What Will Be Your Responsibilities


Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to collect, process and store large volumes of data from various sources.
ETL Processes: Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently transformed and loaded into data storage systems.
Database Management: Manage and optimize databases and data warehouses to ensure data integrity, performance and availability.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, including APIs, databases and external data providers, to create unified datasets for analysis.
Data & Analytics Platform development & expansion: support the expansion of our Data & Analytics Platform.
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide the necessary data infrastructure and support.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing and retrieval.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, ETL processes and database schemas.


Profile And Requirements


Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services, with a focus on Google Cloud. Google Cloud certification is preferred.
Knowledge of data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Informatica).
Experience with data modeling and schema design.
Experience with Iaac (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), data pipeline orchestration (e.g. Airflow), log exploration tools (e.g. Streamlit, Dash), data extraction (e.g. PostGIS, Kafka, Airflow, FastAPI), pandas, scikit-learn, Docker.
Basic understanding of DevOps best practices and tools: GIT, CI/CD, telemetry and monitoring, etc.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering scalable and efficient data solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Language Requirements: Advanced proficiency in Portuguese and English, with proven fluency at the C2 level in both languages.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

What We Have To Offer You


An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world;
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics;
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems;
Flexible work arrangements;
Professional development opportunities;
Collaborative and inclusive work environment;
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.


Do you want to know more about us ?

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Engineer to join our growing data team. In this role, you will be instrumental in building, maintaining, and optimizing our data infrastructure, with a strong emphasis on DataOps principles. You will work closely with data analysts, and other engineers to ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of our data pipelines.

Key Responsibilities


Translate the business requirements into technical specifications, in cooperation with the data product owner.
Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines using Airflow.
Utilize dbt for data transformation and modeling, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Employ Terraform for infrastructure as code (IaC), automating the provisioning and management of our data infrastructure.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for data engineering workflows.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks.
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Contribute to the development of data engineering best practices and standards.
Manage and maintain data repositories using Git.
Automate data-related tasks to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Cooperate with the support teams and provide L3 support to comply with predefined SLA’s


Key Qualifications


University degree in computer science, engineering, or comparable field.
3-5 years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Experience with data warehousing concepts and technologies.
Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) data services (e.g., BigQuery, Cloud Storage)
Knowledge of dbt and version management tools (e.g. Git).
Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform.
Experience with workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Experience working with SAP platforms as data sources (e.g., SAP ECC, SAP S/4HANA, SAP BW, SAP Datasphere).
Knowledge of SAP data structures and extraction methods.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g. Looker).
Scrum methodology.

Title: Data Analyst Team Leader - RISK BCEF
Description:
About The Job


Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As the RISK Reporting Team Leader, you will oversee the Lisbon team responsible for producing BCEF’s RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in collaboration with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also be responsible for producing credit risk reporting and indicators to meet increasing regulatory requirements and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank’s credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines – LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF


Your Main Activities Are


Ensure the smooth execution and proper planning of the team’s tasks, ensuring deadlines are met
Supervise and contribute to the production of capital controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall)
Supervise and contribute to the creation of dashboards and presentation explaining RWA amounts and variations
Supervise and contribute to the production of credit risk indicators and regulatory reporting (especially for recharges or new securitization vehicles)
Analyze and explain key metrics, trends, and areas for analysis from both business and risk perspectives
Be proactive in adapting and transforming reports and analyses to meet requests and evolving needs
Improve the permanent control framework (especially for run capital) to deliver timely, reliable, and consistent analysis and ensure that procedures are followed
Ensure effective cooperation between the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Lisbon and Paris and be the key contact for the Paris teams, providing support when needed
Facilitate the development and knowledge enhancement of team members


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Business Management or related
At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics / Information Technology or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Python
SQL
Power BI
Ability to share/pass on knowledge
Active listening
Ability to manage a project
Ability to develop others and improve their skills

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst, for a project based in Lisbon.




Responsabilities:

Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing, and loading
Responsible for code and query optimization
Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks
Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users
Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost
Data Ingestion
Data processing
Data Quality
Support




Requirements:

Advanced Python (Mandatory)
Advanced SQL skills and relational database management (Oracle is Mandatory, SQL server is desirable, PostgreSQL is desirable )
PySpark (Mandatory)
Experience with Data Warehouses
Apache Airflow (Desirable experience in pipeline development)
Agile methodologies (Scrum)
Git (Is a plus)
Experience with Parquet file format (Is a plus)
Experience in creating APIs in Python (Is a plus)
Fluent in English (written and oral)




#letsgrowtogether 🚀




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Analista De Dados Junior
Description:
Na IRIUM Queremos que persigas sempre os teus sonhos!

Aqui, prepara-te para conquistares as tuas metas, enquanto desfrutas do caminho.

Atualmente encontramo-nos à procura de Analista de dados Junior: Requisitos: Acompanhar e monitorizar a performance de operações, de forma a assegurar a qualidade do serviço prestado end-to-end. Recolher e sistematizar dados operacionais das diferentes áreas da DGR, elaborando relatórios para diferentes intervenientes (i.e., controlo interno, clientes, fornecedores, etc.

). Desenvolver e implementar procedimentos para auditorias aleatórias e regulares das intervenções no terreno, incluindo atividades como a preparação de checklists de auditoria, a programação de auditorias e a análise inicial dos resultados. Identificar os equipamentos xTM que não cumprem os requisitos mínimos de rede. Acompanhar o estado atual do hardware dos componentes e terminais, identificando falhas ou necessidades de atualizações para garantir a operacionalidade. Gerir o funcionamento da rede xTM, incluindo atualização na rede das últimas versões de software autorizadas para xTM, e controlo e verificação de BIOS, bitlockers, templates, lista de fallbacks e IMs ativos. Auxiliar na análise das funcionalidades críticas dos sistemas de suporte à operação, contribuindo com insights para garantir a escalabilidade e flexibilidade. Identificar, criar e acompanhar as evoluções (EVs) junto das equipas de desenvolvimento.

Domínio de ferramentas Microsoft Office (preferencialmente Access e Excel). Capacidade de comunicação oral e escrita e domínio da língua inglesa. Conhecimentos de Power BI. Localização: Lisboa, Alfragide

Regime: Híbrido

O que oferecemos? Uma empresa inovadora e em crescimento, com muitas oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional.

Retribuição de acordo com a tua experiência e performance.

Acesso a retribuição flexível e seguro médico como benefício social.

Acesso ilimitado a formação tecnológica em modalidade livre.

Sobre a empresa: A IRIUM é uma empresa formada por profissionais dinâmicos e proativos.

Os nossos valores são a responsabilidade e o compromisso com a qualidade do trabalho.

Este é o espírito que procuramos na IRIUM, seja qual for a tua idade.

Se te reconheces nestes valores, esta é a tua empresa!

Podemos construir juntos o futuro.

Falamos?

Como candidatar-se: Envie a tua candidatura para: ****** Compromisso com a igualdade: Na IRIUM defendemos um mundo sem estereótipos nem limitações e acreditamos na igualdade para todos, princípios que subscrevemos no nosso Plano de Igualdade e Código de Ética, garantindo a igualdade de tratamento e de oportunidades à margem de qualquer condição pessoal, física ou social.

Recolher e sistematizar dados operacionais das diferentes áreas da DGR, elaborando relatórios para diferentes intervenientes (i.e., controlo interno, clientes, fornecedores, etc.

). Desenvolver e implementar procedimentos para auditorias aleatórias e regulares das intervenções no terreno, incluindo atividades como a preparação de checklists de auditoria, a programação de auditorias e a análise inicial dos resultados. Identificar os equipamentos xTM que não cumprem os requisitos mínimos de rede. Acompanhar o estado atual do hardware dos componentes e terminais, identificando falhas ou necessidades de atualizações para garantir a operacionalidade. Gerir o funcionamento da rede xTM, incluindo atualização na rede das últimas versões de software autorizadas para xTM, e controlo e verificação de BIOS, bitlockers, templates, lista de fallbacks e IMs ativos. Auxiliar na análise das funcionalidades críticas dos sistemas de suporte à operação, contribuindo com insights para garantir a escalabilidade e flexibilidade. Identificar, criar e acompanhar as evoluções (EVs) junto das equipas de desenvolvimento.

Domínio de ferramentas Microsoft Office (preferencialmente Access e Excel). Capacidade de comunicação oral e escrita e domínio da língua inglesa. Conhecimentos de Power BI. Localização: Lisboa, Alfragide

Regime: Híbrido

O que oferecemos? Uma empresa inovadora e em crescimento, com muitas oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional.

Retribuição de acordo com a tua experiência e performance.

Acesso a retribuição flexível e seguro médico como benefício social.

Acesso ilimitado a formação tecnológica em modalidade livre.

Sobre a empresa: A IRIUM é uma empresa formada por profissionais dinâmicos e proativos.

Os nossos valores são a responsabilidade e o compromisso com a qualidade do trabalho.

Este é o espírito que procuramos na IRIUM, seja qual for a tua idade.

Se te reconheces nestes valores, esta é a tua empresa!

Podemos construir juntos o futuro.

Falamos?

Como candidatar-se: Envie a tua candidatura para: ****** Compromisso com a igualdade: Na IRIUM defendemos um mundo sem estereótipos nem limitações e acreditamos na igualdade para todos, princípios que subscrevemos no nosso Plano de Igualdade e Código de Ética, garantindo a igualdade de tratamento e de oportunidades à margem de qualquer condição pessoal, física ou social.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A PrimeIT é uma empresa de referência, focada na prestação de serviços tecnológicos de IT, Telecomunicações e Engenharia. Potenciamos o negócio dos nossos parceiros, recorrendo à tecnologia mais avançada e aos melhores profissionais do sector. Somos especializados em Team Extension, Nearshore, Managed Services e Custom Software. Para isso, contamos atualmente com uma equipa de mais de 2300 profissionais que colaboram em projetos nacionais e internacionais nas mais diversas tecnologias.


📢 Procuramos um Data Analyst.

💻 Regime: Híbrido (em Lisboa).


🔎 O que procuramos?

✅Pelo menos 3 anos de experiência na área de dados;

✅Domínio de SQL;

✅Experiência prática com Python, utilizando bibliotecas como Pandas e NumPy para manipulação e análise de dados;

✅Sólida experiência com SQL Server;

✅Familiaridade com processos de ETL, nomeadamente através da ferramenta SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services);

✅Experiência na criação de dashboards e relatórios interativos com Power BI;

✅Fortes conhecimentos em SSRS.


👉🏼 O que oferecemos?

✅Integração numa empresa de dimensão internacional que cresce diariamente;

✅Formação constante nas mais recentes e inovadoras tecnologias - Prime Academy;

✅Acompanhamento e progressão de carreira.


📩 Envia o teu CV para ccsantos@primeit.pt e junta-te à equipa PrimeIT!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
PrimeIT is a leading company with over 17 years of experience in providing IT, Telecommunications, and Engineering technology services. Specializing in Team Extension, Managed Services, Custom Software, and Nearshore, we currently have a team of over 2,350 professionals working on national and international projects across various technologies.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for this project!




What are we looking for?

Strong knowledge of Power BI, including Power Query, M, and DAX.
Solid SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience integrating data from APIs, Excel, CSV files, and databases.
Knowledge of SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) is a plus for future involvement in ETL projects.




Responsibilities:

Create dashboards in Power BI according to client requirements.
Analyze data to ensure KPIs and metrics are aligned with business objectives.
Implement and support dashboards, adjusting or adding information as needed.
Manage ETL processes, ensuring proper data preparation and transformation for reporting.




What do we offer?

Integration into an international company with a presence in over 50 cities worldwide.
Continuous training in the latest and most innovative technologies – Prime Academy.
Career development and support.

📩 Send us your CV and join the Prime team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise

With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.







🔎We are looking for a Data Analyst




MAIN TASKS:




Create data pipelines in Airflow for data extraction, processing, and loading
Optimize code and queries for performance and efficiency
Generate insights and identify trends, anomalies, or opportunities to improve user experience
Deliver data in useful and appealing formats to end users
Understand business changes and requirement needs, and assess their impact and cost
Perform data ingestion from various sources
Process and transform data for analysis and reporting
Ensure data quality and consistency across systems
Provide support for data-related issues and system reliability




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Proficient in Python programming (mandatory)
Strong expertise in SQL and relational databases, with mandatory experience in Oracle; familiarity with SQL Server and PostgreSQL is desirable
Hands-on experience with PySpark (mandatory)
Familiarity with Git version control is considered a plus
Experience developing pipelines using Apache Airflow is desirable
Comfortable working within Agile environments, particularly with SCRUM methodology
Fluent in English




📍Hybrid Model at the Lisbon office




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? 🔍

If your answer is yes, it’s your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! 👀




🧐 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR IN YOU?

Experience in Data Domain, Data Dictionary, Data Governance.
Expertise (E2 at least) in SQL and preparing medium to high complexity queries. Good to have - exposure to RDBMS, NoSQL, cloud Databases - Redshift/Snowflake as well as flat files - as per real world scenarios.
Data sampling, Data quality analysis, Data Modelling.
Responsible for Data mapping deliverables (Source-to-target mappings) as well as Data dictionary providing a detailed understanding of new product builds.
Adept in analytical abilities to determine root cause for data issues with quick turnaround.
Awareness/Understanding of GDPR and Data encryption best practices and norms followed as per global IT standards.
Familiarity with Aviation domain - is an added advantage. Alternatively quick learner to adapt to Airlines Operations domain terms and terminologies - considering the client landscape.
Provide playback of role specific deliverables to Build teams to provide in depth end to end Data flow understanding for product.
Should have a good balance of business, data and moderate technical understanding - to enable effective stakeholder management.




📅 WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Lisbon + hybrid work
Work Schedule: 9AM to 6PM




🤝 WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract 📋
Pay and benefits 💸 - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan + Health Insurance).
Opportunity knocks 👍🏻 - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews.
Learn as you grow 📚 - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.
Bring your buddy 👫 - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you’ll receive a very attractive cash award.
Connect globally 🌏 - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.
And so on 🎉 - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!




💡 WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968, being part of the Tata Group.

With a presence in 55 countries and over 600,000 employees, TCS is recognized as the #1 Employer in Europe by the Top Employers Institute 🥇

In our portfolio of services, we have information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS 🎯

We stand out for our experience, reliability, passion, confidence, creativity and skills 💯




WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! 🚀

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Join Us at Closer Consulting! 🚀




Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence. 🌟

Developing projects in diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation – we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home. We provide our people with the means, opportunities, and support they need to thrive and innovate. 💡✨




📍 For this position, it is necessary to have a residence in Lisbon, PT




We’re on the lookout for a Data Analyst to join a long-term hybrid project within a complex IT environment, working side by side with our Closer team. ☕💻




This role focuses on Data Management and Data Quality, so we need someone experienced in agile environments and skilled at bridging the gap between business and IT. 🧠 If you think in terms of product, data, and efficiency, we want to hear from you! 📊




🎯 Main responsibilities:

Supporting the writing and structuring of story points with a focus on data; 📝
Converting technical specifications and business needs into clear requirements for development; 🔍
Create and optimize processes geared towards efficiency and data quality; ⚙️
Work closely with Process Mining and Process Automation teams; 🤖
Ensure data governance and quality throughout its lifecycle. 🔐




Profile:

Solid experience as a Data Analyst, working across business and IT; 💼
Ease of communication with technical and non-technical stakeholders; 🗣️
Knowledge of Data Governance, Data Management, Data Quality, Data Efficiency and Data Scope; 📚
We value experience with data cataloging and governance frameworks; 🧾
Seniority: Senior profile or with 3+ years of experience, provided they have good soft skills. 🌟




🛠️ Tech stack:

Databricks 🔧
Azure ☁️
Purview 🔎
Power BI 📈




🔹 We believe we are the ones to:

Providing a multidisciplinary Team 💼
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely 🏡
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth 📈
Providing you with a custom training plan 🎓
Helping you reach happiness 😊




🔹 Oh… and by the way, we also have:

Several challenging complex projects 🧩
Stimulating teams and leaders 💡
World-class Clients and Partners 🌍




📬 If you enjoy turning data into business-driving decisions, we'd like to talk to you. Send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and discover the closer side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.




At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)
HTML:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!


At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.


For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!


Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.


Your Mission Will Be:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders from different sectors to identify and understand their specific analytical needs and challenges;
  • Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for improvement and customization;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide actionable insights;
  • Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need:

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in data analysis;
  • Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
  • Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English (other languages are a plus);
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have:

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
  • Experience in query languages such as SQL;
  • Familiarity with business intelligence principles and data management practices.


With Us You Can Be a:

  • TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
  • TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
  • InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
  • InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Business Data Analyst – Commercial
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.


You Bring


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently


Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we’re happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths — so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.
Show more
HTML:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks

  • Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
  • Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
  • Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
  • Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
  • Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
  • Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
  • Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
  • Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.

You Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
  • Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
  • Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
  • Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
  • Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
  • Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
  • Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
  • Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently

Why join Usercentrics?

  • Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
  • Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
  • Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
  • Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
  • We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
  • You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we’re happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being

About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths — so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (“RISK MFI”) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (“GM”) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies




Dealroom is the world’s startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world’s next generation of transformative companies.

We’re on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.




About the Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.




As a Data Curator, you’ll

Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.




What You Bring

Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.




What We Bring to the Deal

Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we’ll support your growth.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.




Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let’s create something transformative together.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

netum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023

Job Description

The purpose of this role is to provide data analysis and reporting tools for the VERDI team or assimilate (Compliance, top management, IG, Business) on an ad hoc and a regular basis using a variety of tools and programming skills.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities


Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing, and loading
Responsible for code and query optimization
Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks
Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users
Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost
Data Ingestion
Data processing
Data Quality
Support


Qualifications

Technical skills:


Advanced Python
Advanced SQL skills and relational database management (Oracle is Mandatory, SQL server is desirable, PostgreSQL is desirable )
PySpark
Git - (is a plus)
Experience with Data Warehouses
Experience with Parquet file format is a plus
Experience in creating APIs in Python is a plus
Apache Airflow - Experience in pipeline development is desirable
Agile methodologies (At least SCRUM)


Language Skills


Fluent in English (Mandatory)


Soft Skills


Good communication skills
Strong analytical abilities, able to have the right synthesis and all possible details at same time
Team spirit
Client Focus
Adaptability skills
Show more

  • Strong analytical abilities, able to have the right synthesis and all possible details at same time
  • Team spirit
  • Client Focus
  • Adaptability skills

Title: Business - Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Run requirements workshops.
Create structured user stories for developers to be able to work on moving data from source to destination systems.


Qualifications


At least 4 years' experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst;
Proven experience in Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence and data migration projects;
Good knowledge of Oracle;
Good knowledge of English.


What Do I Need Before I Apply


The candidate must be resident in Portugal.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Integer Consulting é uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria em tecnologias de informação. Somos especialistas em serviços de IT outsourcing, software, projetos de nearshore e desenvolvimento à medida. Somos parceiros dos principais players tecnológicos a nível mundial e trabalhamos com empresas nacionais e multinacionais de diversos setores de atividade. A maioria dos projetos em que participamos são em Portugal, no Brasil e um pouco por toda a Europa. O que nos diferencia é o talento tecnológico e a experiência das pessoas que fazem parte da equipa e que integram os nossos projetos.

Estás à procura de novas oportunidades na área de IT? Temos novidades para ti!

Este Pode Ser o Desafio Perfeito, Se Tiveres


+3 anos de experiência na implementação de projetos em ferramentas Microsoft Data Analytics;
Experiência em Power BI, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) e SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS);
+2 anos de experiência na definição de requisitos funcionais junto das áreas de negócio e desenho técnico de soluções de Data Analytics;
Inglês fluente (obrigatório)

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Direção de Customer Intelligence


Trabalhar numa empresa líder na transformação do negócio bancário em Portugal? Pode ser esta a oportunidade!


ÁGIL, MODERNO, PRÓXIMO, SIMPLES E SUSTENTÁVEL


O Millennium bcp tem uma estratégia de Sustentabilidade que incorpora e promove uma cultura corporativa de responsabilidade ambiental e social, assente em práticas de negócio ético, inclusivo e responsável.


Valorizamos as pessoas e acreditamos que fazem a diferença!


Responsabilidades

  • Tradução de necessidades de negócio em requisitos técnicos e soluções de analytics;
  • Criação e implementação de modelos de segmentação avançados, com o objetivo de aprofundar o conhecimento sobre os comportamentos, necessidades e preferências dos Clientes, permitindo identificar padrões, prever tendências e direcionar estratégias personalizadas que maximizem o valor para o negócio.
  • Comunicação eficaz com diferentes stakeholders, desde equipas técnicas até à comissão executiva;
  • Compreensão sólida de indicadores chave de desempenho (KPIs) no contexto bancário e capacidade de analisar o seu impacto no negócio.


Qualificações e Experiência

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado/Pós-Graduação em Data Science, Matemática, Estatística, Engenharia Informática ou áreas similares;
  • 5+ anos de experiência em Analytics, preferencialmente no setor bancário e com foco em Cliente;
  • Experiência no acompanhamento e evolução de membros mais juniores com evidência de impacto no seu crescimento;
  • Experiência na colaboração efetiva com parceiros na área de dados (ex: Data Scientists, BI Developers etc)
  • Experiência em projetos de segmentação de Clientes;
  • Experiência na liderança de projetos de Analytics com evidência de utilização de dados e insights para influenciar decisões ao nível da experiência digital, comunicação com clientes e desenho da oferta de produtos/serviços.


Competências Técnicas

  • Elevada capacidade analítica, pensamento crítico e capacidade de desconstruir problemas complexos;
  • Excelente capacidade de comunicação escrita & verbal a diferentes níveis na organização, com perfis técnicos e não técnicos;
  • Sólidos conhecimentos de data storytelling e boas práticas de visualização de informação;
  • Sólidos conhecimentos em tecnologias de base de dados (SAS ou SQL);
  • Experiência com ferramentas de Reporting (preferencialmente PowerBI) e boas práticas de modelação de dados;
  • Conhecimento de boas práticas na gestão de dados no contexto bancário;
  • Experiência com Azure DevOps (preferencial).


O que propomos:


  • Equilíbrio entre a vida pessoal e profissional;
  • Formação contínua;
  • Remuneração atrativa;
  • Possibilidade de Participação nos lucros da empresa;
  • Hipótese de atribuição de Crédito habitação com condições favoráveis para Colaboradores;
  • Assistência médica e cuidados de saúde – plano de saúde extensivo ao agregado familiar mediante as condições estabelecidas;
  • Protocolos e parcerias com descontos;


O nosso Plano Estratégico 2025-28

No novo Ciclo Estratégico 2025-28, o Millennium bcp aspira valorizar os seus clientes, colaboradores e acionistas. O Banco definiu metas de grupo com o objetivo de alcançar um desempenho superior, com retornos tangíveis.


Local de Trabalho: Taguspark - Oeiras /Regime híbrido

Title: Analista De Dados - Marketing
Description:
omos a Digi, uma Empresa de Telecomunicações nova no mercado português, com mais de 30 anos de história, presente em vários países europeus.Procuramos talentos que queiram construir connosco uma história de sucesso em Portugal.Conhecimentos:


Fortes competências analíticas com proficiência em ferramentas de análise de dados, como Excel e Google Analytics, bem como em ferramentas de visualização, como Looker Studio e Power BI.
Qualificação Obrigatória.
Conhecimentos de Python para manipulação de dados e processos de ETL.
Desejável.
Experiência com o Google Tag Manager para configuração de rastreio e criação de eventos.
Desejável.
Compreensão dos princípios e melhores práticas de e-commerce, incluindo otimização de websites e mapeamento da jornada do cliente - Qualificação Obrigatória.
Conhecimentos com plataformas de e-commerce e familiaridade com sistemas de CRM e ferramentas de automação de marketing são diferenciadores.
Capacidade de traduzir dados complexos em insights práticos e recomendações estratégicas.
Excelentes capacidades de comunicação e colaboração para trabalhar eficazmente com equipas multifuncionais.Principais Responsabilidades:
Recolha e Análise de Dados: Recolher e analisar dados da nossa loja online e plataformas digitais para obter insights sobre o comportamento do cliente, tendências de vendas e desempenho do produto.
Acompanhamento do Desempenho: Monitorizar indicadores-chave de desempenho (KPIs), como fontes de tráfego, taxas de conversão, valor médio do pedido e métricas de retenção de clientes.
Relatórios: Elaborar relatórios e painéis detalhados para comunicar as conclusões, tendências e recomendações práticas aos intervenientes.
Otimização: Identificar oportunidades de melhoria na jornada do utilizador e nos esforços promocionais com base na análise de dados.
Análise da Concorrência: Realizar análises competitivas para comparar o desempenho da nossa loja online, identificar tendências de mercado e recomendar iniciativas estratégicas.
Visualização de Dados: Crie visualizações e apresentações para comunicar insights de forma eficaz e impulsionar a tomada de decisões com base em dados.
Previsão e Análise Preditiva: Utilize dados históricos e técnicas de modelação preditiva para prever tendências de vendas, necessidades de stock e valor da vida útil do cliente.Qualificações:
Licenciatura em Marketing, Estatística ou área afim.
Experiência de 2 a 3 anos em cargo similar - Habilitação Obrigatória.
O domínio do inglês é essencial; domínio do espanhol é uma mais-valia.Caso esta função se enquadre no seu plano de carreira e queira fazer parte da história de sucesso que estamos a construir, não deixe de se candidatar.Envie pf o seu CV para ******, ao qual daremos resposta no prazo máximo de duas semanas caso seja o(a) candidato(a) selecionado(a).
A Digi Portugal atua de forma ética, pelo que não discrimina com base em critérios de ascendência, idade, sexo, orientação sexual, identidade de género, estado civil, situação familiar, situação económica, instrução, origem ou condição social, património genético, capacidade de trabalho reduzida, deficiência, doença crónica, nacionalidade, origem étnica ou raça, território de origem, língua, religião, convicções políticas ou ideológicas e filiação sindical, pelo que todas as candidaturas serão tratadas de acordo com critérios objetivos de avaliação comportamental e técnica, exclusivamente para identificação do perfil adequado.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Semasio, a Samba TV company, is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands trust our industry-leading advertising solutions to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI. Our team is located globally in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany, and Denmark.




We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community. Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks your curiosity, then read on!




Are you passionate about turning data into insights? Do you have a keen eye for detail and a drive to optimize business performance? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are looking for a Junior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team in

Porto. In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and efficiency of our data models and reports. Your contributions will directly impact strategic decision-making, providing stakeholders with critical insights to drive the company forward.




What You’ll Do:
Maintain and update our BI data model, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Own specific monthly reports and updates, ensuring timely and precise delivery.
Work closely with different teams to understand reporting needs and enhance data quality.
Identify opportunities to improve data structures and reporting processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data inconsistencies or anomalies.
Support the development of new dashboards and analytics solutions.




What We’re Looking For:
Strong attention to detail—nothing slips past you!
A problem-solving mindset with a passion for optimizing data processes.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Basic understanding of data modeling concepts and database structures.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive attitude, always looking for ways to improve and streamline reporting.
A degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is a plus.




Why Join Us?
Be part of a data-driven company that values innovation and continuous learning.
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions matter.
Opportunity for professional growth and development in the exciting field of Business Intelligence.









Samba TV is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.




Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, under the applicable law. For further details, please see Samba's Applicant Privacy Policy. For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Data Analyst - Junior/Senior Level
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.







🔎 We are looking for a Data Analyst - Junior and Senior Level




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze large volumes of data to help with business decisions.
Create dashboards and reports in Power BI to show results clearly.
Process, clean and transform data with Python, PySpark or Scala, especially in Big Data environments.
Building data pipelines (ETL) and preparing datasets for analysis.
Collaboration with technical and business teams to ensure data quality and consistency.
Supporting continuous improvement and data governance initiatives.
Automate processes to save time and avoid errors.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Experience in Power BI (modeling, DAX, visualizations).
Python skills applied to data analysis.
Knowledge of PySpark / Spark / Scala (valued in Big Data environments).
Solid knowledge of SQL.
Notions of data quality and governance.
Good communication skills (technical and non-technical).
Analytical mind and problem-solving orientation.
Proactivity and a sense of responsibility.
Proficiency in English (minimum B2).




📍Hybrid Role in Porto.




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!
